												TL;DRHaving a legitimate copy of game was never so unfavorable. ♥♥♥♥ games for windows.On windows 8/10 run with parameters: -availablevidmem 60 -norestrictions -nomemrestrictSo where do I start first?When I tried launching the game nothing was happening, just icon flashing for a while on taskbar.Apparently I had to download myself GFWL from Microsoft website, which was not included in the game.Later I had to verify my game through Rockstar Social Club or something which didn't activate at first, but after several tries it worked.Game launched at 800x600 with everything on low, because game detected only 23MB of video ram.After some searching i had to modify a bit launching parameters (-nomemrestrict).Then when I finally got into game had to create an GFWL account to let me save my ♥♥♥♥ing progress in game (they don't store your progress on cloud, they just want you to log in for "achievements").Clicked play after sitting in front of loading screen for 5 minutes I realised something is wrong.After MORE research i had to modify again launch parameters to -availablevidmem 60 -norestrictions -nomemrestrict.Seriously, what the ♥♥♥♥ is that? You pay for a game that you need to tweak half an hour after searching some info on the internet? Why is this still on shop unpached without any information about it being unable to launch without this mess??The game itself is okay in my opinion, but they should pay more attention to games they still are selling.

content:
Posted: November 4, 2016
												ALL GTA IV AND GTA IV EPISODES FROM LIBERTY CITY FIXES!!!This is a fix review for GTA IV and GTA IV Episodes From Liberty City, on whether you should buy these games.The short answer is NO! and here is why...First off, I loved the story of GTA IV and GTA IV Episodes From Liberty City, in my eyes I had just as much fun with them as any other GTA game. The reason why I am not recommending them however is because of the shear number of Port Issues these 2 games have.Now, I am going to tell you all the issues and how to fix them but even so, the reason I do NOT recommend them is because Rockstar have done nothing in years to fix these bugs and even beyond that the Online is completly broken and yet they do NOT specify this or any fixes on the Steam Page.1) FIRST BUG - Graphics Card- Ok so basically if you have a Graphics Card that has a video RAM of over 2GB, (I have a 4GB GTX 970 myself) both games do NOT allow you to adjust any of the graphics options!This is crazy and so surprised Rockstar have not fixed this :( But to do so, on Steam go to your Library, right click over either GTA IV game and then go to Set Launch Options and enter this without the brackets (-nomemrestrict -norestrictions). Once you ok that you can start up the game ane edit your graphics options like normal :)2) SECOND BUG - Game Not Starting- Ok so this is the biggest one and it seems to be happening a lot to people with Windows 10 like myself. So when you sign into the Rockstar Social Club it either says failed or password not correct (even when it is), something along those lines yeah. Well if you go to the hard drive on your computer where the game is stored and find either Steam>Steamapps>Common>(Then either GTA IV game) or Rockstar Games>(Then either GTA IV game) and find inside either folder these 3 files "gtaencoder","gta4browser","gtaiv" for Grand Theft Auto IV and these 3 files "eflc","gta4browser","gtaencoder" for Grand Theft Auto IV Episodes From Liberty City; then right click on every file and choose Properties>Compatibility and then choose Windows Vista Service Pack 2>Apply>Ok.Now that you have done those steps you should be able to launch the game, Rockstar Social Club pop up, choose Offline and the game actually start up :)3) THIRD BUG - Games For Windows Live- Well we can all agree that this has ruined games...lol!But basically in order for you to be able to sign in to LIVE, you need to go to go here...http://www.xbox.com/en-US/LIVE/PC/DownloadClient...and download this software and install it. You don't need to start it up, just so long as it is on your machine. Once you have done that you will be able to sign into LIVE via the game and start at least earning Achievements until Rockstar fix the Online.4) FOURTH BUG - Online Broken- Sadly at this stage I can't specify a fix for the Online as I have looked at many forums and Rockstar's Website :( I guess only time will tell, but if there is a fix in the future I will be sure to update this section here :)Cheers Guys, please pass on and share as I just want people to enjoy the games :)James.

 it is literally perfect. Episodes from Liberty City is more like a big expansion pack than "DLC." You get two completely new campaigns for an absurdly low price. Lots of new weapons, new vehicles, new helicopters, new cutscenes, new characters, and more explosive.Endless hours of entertainment with this game weather you choose to do missions, or just cause TERROR on the streets of Liberty City. Of course the more missions you complete, the more you're going to have options as far as weapons and newer exotic vehicles to steal. Software itself is well rendered and the modelling within the game is superb. Spectacular graphics with settings maxed out- well worth the upgrade of your video card if required.

I SHOULD BE SENT TO PRISON, SHOULDN'T I?"Rockstar is one of those companies, whose DLC's and EXPANSIONS are really in right meaning of the word. If I don't mind, how they changed their DLC's policy in GTA V which by the time will step into regular EA bulls*it. Don't get me wrong, but Rockstar is starting to make stupid Cars/Skins/Weapons DLC's but at least for free, and I believe they'll fall into darkness of DLC gaming market model sooner or later. Back to the game.As I said before, oficially this game is expansion to GTA IV, but everyone who played it, raise the hands up for me, that this seems (and is) truly standard and actual game. Story is gripping and longer than stories of 90% nowadays games if not more. GTA IV, TBoGT (The Ballad of Gay Tony) and TLaD (The Lost and Damned) makes the universe. All three stories are connected with logical connection, and what happened in GTA IV has affect on these two stories (EFLC - Episodes From Liberty City). Or let's say it has affect on it. It's not like it has some real affect, but it was made to have the affect on it. And it has.Both expansions shows something of both worlds. TBoGT is showing classy high & luxurious style of life while TLaD is showing underground, real side of America. In overall I do like TBoGT more, but Johnny was truly awesome in TLaD.There's also one mission where all 3 characters meets up but now shhh about it. Same with intro. For the price you see at Store Page, you will get two precise full games not just expensions as they are called. Also they're BETTER OPTIMALIZED than GTA IV. So you don't have to worry about your hardware as much as you had to back then with IV.Bonus Point: Lenght & OptimalizationRating: 9/10(for both)

content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
												--- The Lost and Damned ---I'd heard that TLAD was mediocre and paled in comparison to the base game and The Ballad of Gay Tony, but I actually liked it a lot more than the base game.+ Johnny handles motorcycles way better than Niko handles cars+ There aren't any really bad bikes (while most of the cars are terrible)+ You can get bikes for free and guns at a discount whenever you want by calling your gang members+ At the end of an early mission, the game tries to make you think it's gonna go all San Andreas and let your gang get pushed around by a couple of corrupt cops, but you just go kill them in the next mission+ You don't get called to go do things with your friends all the time+ This game introduces the sawn-off shotgun, which is the most hilariously overpowered gun to use on a motorcycle+ Also introduces a few more guns that are more interesting than anything in GTA IV: An automatic pistol, a street sweeper shotgun and a grenade launcher+ I enjoy playing as bikers in games and Johnny has a sweet jacket/ The story is still generally joyless/ The story is short, but there are a lot of side jobs, gang wars and races to do as well/ Johnny flipping his♥♥♥♥♥♥in combat for little reason can be alternately hilarious and annoying. "F*** YOU! F*** YOU! F*** YOU F*** YOU F*** YOU F*** YOU!" (this is all one line)- Only 2 safehouses, both very close together, and you can only use one or the other for most of the plot- Johnny runs slower than Niko and Luis if he's holding a weapon- The bike handling is still iffy, and the 4-wheeled vehicle handling is iffy at best- The death metal station has like 8 songs on it so if you listen to it a lot it will repeat all the time- No character customizationTLAD is still no San Andreas or Vice City but it's a pretty good game.

A DRM Nightmare!- Requires login to Social Club account before launching the game- Resetting the password for the Social Club account didn't work (no email sent) for the first few days- Game doesn't launch because xlive.dll is missing: Requires Games for Windows Live to be installed- Game launches with minimal graphics settings without the ability to change them: Requires "-norestrictions" command line parameter to be set- First mission plays as expected but afterwards it tries to auto-save- Saving the game requires Windows Live account and entering of the product key- "wrong password" message only shown after going through the entire process (i.e. checking checkboxes for various terms and entering credentials and product key)That's when I had enough, force closed the game and uninstalled it.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2014
												Episodes from Liberty City puts you in the shoes of other people trying to make something of themselves in this world. Unlike Niko however, Luis and Johnny have been in this city for a long time; they know what's going on.Episodes from Liberty City brings you two stories, the story of Luis, The Ballad of Gay Tony, pretty self explanatory. And Johnny's story, one of the bikers in the Lost and Damned.In my opinion, Episodes from Liberty City is a much stronger and touching story; even though it does not contain as much sad parts and engaging as Niko's storyline. Sometimes sad stories are not a free pass for a good story.It depends on one's perspective, but to me, GTA 4 and all three of its main storyline, is based on a $2,000,000 worth of diamond(s), and the game just puts you in the shoes of one of the people who are chasing after this diamond. The moral of the story is, we all have a dream, but someone already owns that dream. Sometimes there's people with the exact same dream as you, they're also chasing it. And if you don't make friends with them, bad things are going to happen. In the end, no one achieves that dream, because we all killed each other; but in the end, that dream is given to those who deserve it. And a new chapter of the book begins....

content:
Posted: July 25, 2015
												Copy-pasted from my IV review. This is a review of both GTA IV and EFLC.Honestly one of the best games I have ever played. Compared to V, I think there are some things that IV does better, euphoria physics, vehicle handling, story, realism in general; It's nice if that's the kind of thing you're looking for. V improved in certain areas, and included a lot of things that IV was lacking. I don't think either is better than the other, but I personally prefer IV. The game runs OK, specs:Intel Core i5-3570 3.40GHz8gb RAMAMD HD 7950 (OC)I did some tweaking and I feel like it runs best at these settings:1680x1050 60 Hz (Native)Texture Quality: HighReflection Resolution: Very HighWater Quality: Very HighShadow Quality: HighNight Shadows: OffTexture Filter: Anisotropic x8View Distance: 25Detail Distance: 40Vehicle Density: 100Definition: OffVSync: OffFraps Benchmark: 5 minutes, 21682 framesMin: 47, Max: 102, Avg: 72.23I have the latest patches on both games. Everything is vanilla except for the Visual IV Mod. If you don't have it, you might as well install it. It makes the game look a lot better and apparently includes a "fixed rendering code" to make playing smoother.I run EFLC on the same settings and results were pretty much identical. Everyone is aware that GTA IV is a ♥♥♥♥ port, but I think I've managed to get a somewhat consistent framerate. It still drops to >30 for a few seconds, occasionally. This happens no matter what I do. It's still completely playable and doesn't annoy me at all, but it's something I noticed; It's still miles ahead of the console version. If anyone is able to get a constant 60+ in this game, let me know what you are doing. R* Social club isn't a big deal. GFWL is useless and I don't like it, but it hasn't caused me any trouble so far. Over all, my experience with this game has been really good. The only thing that would make it better is if multiplayer wasn't dead, would've made a nice mod-friendly alternative to GTA: Online.Edit:I felt inclined to update this review after finding out a little more about the graphics settings for this game. GTA IV is not necessarily meant to be maxed out on current hardware, the intention of the developers was that the higher graphical settings would be for future use, and when GTA IV was released on PC back in 2008 there was a disclaimer of some sort that advised players to use medium settings. I'm just learning this now and I had purchased GTA IV in 2012. People are criticizing the game for being a terrible port and having framerate issues because they believe they should be able to max out a 7 year old game. In most cases they would not be wrong in assuming that, but gta iv does have higher minimum requirements than pretty much any other game. Now, with current patches, as long as you have this game configured correctly it will run beautifully.AUTO CONFIGURE IS YOUR FRIEND.Use it when you are tweaking your graphics. If you have a decent rig, most of the settings will be automatically set to high/very high, except for VD, DD, and Vehicle Density. If you want to push it further, I would increase the vehicle density, which has the lowest impact on framerate, and you will be all right leaving everything else alone. Hope this helps anyone thats having trouble running this game.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2014
The Lost and DamnedThis episode focuses on motorcycles, as you would expect from a game that revolves around a biker gang. If GTA4 wasn't gritty enough for you, this one's even grittier. Storywise, it's about the same level of grittiness as GTA4, if not more, If you like riding bikes, you'll like this episode; Johnny Klebitz has mastered the delicate art of not flying off his bike when clipping a lamp post at 20 miles an hour. Though he's not as good of a driver as Niko, and you'll definitely notice that if and when you get behind the wheel. There's more content in general, including an exclusive set of weapons to play with, including an autopistol, a sawed-off shotgun, and a grenade launcher. You get all three of these pretty damn early in the game; the sawed-off is Johnny's starter weapon and he can fire it while riding! Worth playing if you want to follow a parallel, equally if not more gritty story to Niko's.Lost MC! Lost MC!The Ballad of Gay TonyThis episode takes a leap away from GTA4's usual brand of grittiness; it's more colorful, has lots of new fun guns to play with (P90 SMG, advanced sniper rifle, M249 light machine gun, AA-12 shotgun with explosive rounds...), parachutes, upgraded police units, and a whackier tone to compete with its new nemesis, Saints Row 2. This one focuses a bit more on helicopters, so this episode may be good practice for the awful PC controls for the helicopters. Or it may frustrate you a bit. Once you finish the story, you can go back and replay any mission you want. There's a score system for missions this time around, but who cares? I actually find this episode to be more fun than GTA4 just because of all the fun stuff it adds. There's nothing like screwing up everyone's commute in Star Junction with stickybombs and an explosive shotgun. What's that? The police are coming? Pfft. They ain't got♥♥♥♥♥♥on my APC.You'll have a good time. And as always, mods only increase the fun.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2016
												A MUST have addition to GTA IV. It basically retells the story of Libertiy City on the same time era as NIko from additional two different perspectives. A lot of events and mission end up tying between the three protagonists (Niko, Johnny, and Luis).The Lost and Damned (TLaD)Summary: American 60's biker drama (greasers, junkie girlfriend, running with the politic and mafia, pushers, internal dispute, etc.) There are lot of interesting gameplay mechanics introduced since you are now in bike club. Eg: You get to roll with your brothers (that's what they call each other); with each successful mission (and them not dying), they will receive 'EXP' to upgrade their survivability and weaponry. (Note: noobs brother tend to die easily, but main story brothers won't die unless the story tells so) The Ballad of Gay Tony (TBoGT)Spoiler: Actually not gay. Lots of booty calls (note: NOT from dudes). Dude who you are working for (Tony Prince, AKA Gay Tony) is the one who's gay; dude runs clubs in town with some 'business' partners. I played TBoGT a long time ago; frankly I don't remember any new interesting things thrown in except for booty calls. I do recall sweet♥♥♥♥♥helicopter (an upgrade from Annihilator) from rich♥♥♥♥♥racist Arab. You can replay missions though since each mission has this 'additional objectives' in order for you to get the 100%/ gold medal ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and make yourself feel less terrible.Pros:+ Don't need to own GTA IV (But highly recommended to finish the main game first; this game assumes player has experienced base game. A lot of references are thrown here and there as story progresses)+ A lot of new arsenals introduced. They are exclusive to each stories (and are more OP in some cases)+ Complete different atmospheres with some new mechanics+ Feels more optimised than the base gameCons:- Takes another 16 GB of files even if you own GTA IV (since Episodes from Liberty City is considered a separate game). It is such a waste of space, considering 90% of the game files are recycled- Generic missions, with some minor bugs here and there- They RIP APART Vladivostok FM into pop dance club ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t FM. GIVE ME BACK Кино́'s Группа крови!Overall, if you or your friends are thinking of picking up GTA IV, get the Episodes from LIberty City as well.

content:
Posted: July 27, 2016
												In Episodes From Liberty City (EFLC), we play as 2 of the characters that cross paths with Niko Bellic and each other a  few times during Niko's story and learn mode details about the diamonds, secondary characters, and the city itself.All the pros and cons of Vanilla GTA IV apply to the expansions as well, so I'll only mention the differences.JUST LIKE THE VANILLA GTA IV, THE X.LIVE.LESS MOD IS ALMOST OBLIGATORY TO REMOVE GFLW, AND BE ABLE TO PLAY IT LIKE IT SHOULD BE PLAYEDThe Lost and DamnedWe play as Johnny Klebitz, the vice president of The Lost Motorcycle Club, as the Club struggles to stay dominant and alive in the gang wars of LC+ Improved motorcycle handling, now it's harder to fall off the bike (Sometimes unrealistically harder)+ New vehicles added (Mostly bikes)+ Darker tone and very interesting story+ New locations and activities, mostly MC related+ New weapons,also fitting the MC theme ( and the ability to use more weapons while riding, like the baseball bat and the sawed off shotgun)+ New songs and new TV/radio shows (Even more rock!)- Lack of more safehouses- No character customization- The new vehicles, locations, and weapons are not accessible on the vanilla GTA IVThe Ballad of Gay TonyWe play as Luiz Lopez, a security guard, and friend of Gay tony, a very rich nightclub owner.+ Get to experience the more "glamorous" side of Liberty City+ More Vehicles added (mostly luxury, also we get an attack helicopter and an APC)+ Parachuting is back!+ Very fun missions (If you liked those more over-the-top missions from previous games, You'll like the ones here)+ New activities and locations, mostly nightclub related+ New TV/Radio shows, songs and a new radio station (80's!) - Only one safehouse- The new vehicles, locations, and weapons are not accessible on the vanilla GTA IVThis is one of the best expansion packs I've ever seen, it has a lot of content and is completely stand-alone from the main GTA IVThis is how DLC should me made, this is a must have if you liked GTA IV

number of helpful: 19 of 24 people (79%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
												Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City is an expansion pass for GTA 4 where you have to DLC packs which both expand on the story of GTA 4. I will review both as separate games so let's get into it.Grand Theft Auto Lost and Damned:This expansion pass follows on the biker gang Lost and Damned who are old school gang in Liberty City. The story follows on Johny Klebitz as he tries his best to keep his chapter under falling out.This expansion is really good, for story, but not so much for missions. Now I know that I should have expected this, from an expansion that follows on Bikers, but I didn't really like how much of the entire expansion follows on bike rides. But the story missions were fun and challenging.Music wise I enjoyed the rock music in this game, it's a very fitting choice of music for this expansion and it works well.The entire expansion overall is still better than the entirety of GTA 4, I enjoyed the story and action based missions, but hated all the bike stuff, because of how bikes control in GTA 4 overall.Next up is Grand Theft Auto The Ballad of Gay Tony:This expansion is better than Lost and Damned and GTA 4.This expansion follows on Luis a bodyguard who works on a business man Gay Tony. The entire expansion takes place after the Three Leaf Clover mission in GTA 4 and is all about Luis trying to save Tony's dying business by taking up different business ventures.This expansion is incredibly fun and I had tons of fun playing through it. A lot of the missions are really fun action packed missions and it fixes a lot of the problems that Lost and Damned and GTA 4 had.The overall atmosphere is also not as dark and lightens the tone. It's also incredibly funny, the characters are funny and it's all really fun. Lightening the tone also helps a lot, cause GTA 4 being way too serious made the game kind of boring to play. This expansion also paves the way to GTA 5 like the medals in missions and multiple characters.Overall this expansion is a great addition and is overall better than the main game, but I still suggest playing all three games.Pros:+ Funny and cleverly written stories+ Missions are action packed so it never gets boring to play+ Soundtracks which fit the overall atmosphere of the expansionsCons:- Gameplay and Car physics aren't that good- Gun gameplay is incredibly stiffFinal Rating:9/10

Posted: April 1
												A relatively short yet interesting expansion of the original GTA IV, this pack actually comprises of 2 storyline games, The Lost and Damned and The Ballad of Gay Tony, in which you can either play as the biker Johnny Klebitz, or the prestigious Luis Fernando Lopez, respectively.While EFLC is much shorter than the original game, it still shows Liberty City from two completely different perspectives, with one of them being the lifestyle of bikers (bikes, booze, drugs, rock 'n' roll and babes) and the other being the modern, night club lifestyle (fancy sports cars, dancing, pop, booze and babes too).The only cons of the PC version are the inclusion of the obsolete Windows gaming services, which are completely useless and even at times disrupting for the players, and the poor job with the port, which requires you to own a beefy PC to play it on higher settings.Overall, it's a damn fine expansion and I completely recommend it if you're a fan of open world and third person shooter games.

number of helpful: 12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 14, 2013
												As I write this, the release date for GTA V is fast approaching. Hard to believe it's been 5 years since GTA4 was released.GTA: Episodes from Liberty City (EFLC) moves the base GTA4 game forward nicely. There's two smaller storylines, each about 12-16 hours of gameplay. Both stories are interwoven with the main GTA4 storyline. Niko Bellic and other characters make appearances in these games, and certain loose ends are tied up in these episodes.The stories are strong, the supporting characters are interesting, and the protagonists are fun to play. Luis Lopez, the main character in The Ballad of Gay Tony, is my new favorite GTA protagonist - even better than Vice City's Tommy Vercetti. These two smaller games are much more interesting to me than Niko Bellic's story.EFLC delivers some technical fixes and gameplay improvements to the base game.  Most notably, we now have mid-mission checkpoints, so if you fail a mission, you can pick up part-way through. This really decreases the frustration level of the game. Less notably, but important to me: traffic is more realistic. And, motorcycles are easier to control.The Ballad of Gay Tony is the standout episode. It brings back the over-the-top flavor of Vice City and San Andreas. The missions are crazy fun, including a shootout on top of the Empire State Building, hijacking a subway car, helicopter duels, and a race around Manhattan -- excuse me, "Algonquin" -- involving parachutes, speedboats and fast cars. There's a new cage-fighting mini-game, and everywhere you turn in this one, there's fast cars to boost. And, as mentioned, parachuting! There's 20 optional missions involving base jumping and parachuting skills. Excellent fun. The Ballad of Gay Tony pulls out all the stops to show off what this game engine is capable of delivering. And maybe, hopefully, it shows that Rockstar hasn't forgotten how to have fun. If you need a GTA fix before GTA V appears and you skipped these episodes, you should definitely take a second look.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2016
												Overall a great game, got it working on Windows 10 too.Last time I played was in Windows 7 and it worked fine, but getting it working in Windows 10 was kind of a pain. I could always play it in Windows 7 by putting GFWL on offline mode, but this time there doesn't seem to be an offline option.First of all, install "Games For Windows Marketplace" (google it, should be the first result, xbox.com page), set up an account if you don't have one. The game may automatically direct you to the download link upon trying to launch it for the first time, it did for me. You may get a prompt from Windows 10 that it's not compatible, but install it anyway. Without Games For Windows Live/Marketplace installed, the game won't launch at all.Make sure you put "-nomemrestrict -norestrictions" (without quotes of course) in the game's launch options (right click it in Steam library, select Properties). If you don't, the game won't let you change resolution or any graphics settings.From the main menu, pick the LIVE option and sign in. It may take a while, maybe not, but just be patient if it seems to take a while. At some point it will also ask for your game key. Don't try to close the GFWL overlay in the game while it's signing in either, I did and the whole thing became unresponsive.It may ask you to update GFWL, I updated but it may not be necessary. If you choose to update, it will ask you to exit and re-launch the game, just sign in again from the main menu using the LIVE option. When I tried to sign in when prompted while starting a new game, it crashed. So using the LIVE option from the main menu was necessary for me. It will also download your "Profile" this may also take a bit, again just be patient.Once you're signed into LIVE go ahead and start a new game, it should work without any problems.It's been a while since I played this game and it was a pain to get it working this time, but so far it was worth it. I almost gave up at one point, was gonna chalk it up to the game being incompatible with Windows 10. It actually works fine under Windows 10, it's just this Games For Windows Live/Marketplace stuff that gets in the way.TL;DRTo get EFLC working in Windows 10:1) Install Games For Windows Marketplace, sign up for an account if you don't have one.2) Put "-nomemrestrict -norestrictions" (without quotes) in launch options for game.3) Launch game, set up graphics, sign into GFWL using the "LIVE" option in the main menu. It may take a while, be patient. It may ask for the game key, just put it in and it will work.4) Start a new game.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												This is pretty much GTA IV on steroids. TLaD expands the base game a bit, especially by adding many new bikes.TBoGT feels like a true evolution (something like Vice City compared to GTA III). There is a quite significant amount of new vehicles (which reappear in GTA V), fun weapons and other minor details, like base jumping. The majority of missions involves doing rather crazy stuff, especially in comparison to the base game. In fact, to me it felt like a bridge between GTA IV and V.The only thing I didn't really like was the fact that GTA IV's campaign was longer. The EFLC's ones are rather short, despite the existence of repetetive side missions.Still, fun-wise, TBoGT is the greatest thing since San Andreas (I'm not counting GTA V because I haven't played it yet).

content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City*In this review, I'll be covering TLaD and TBoGTStory (TBoGT) - I loved it, full of action. Last mission was really cool. But some missions could be better. 9/10Story (TLaD) - It was alright, it had many awesome moments, but at the same time the game felt really dark. 8/10Storyline Length (TBoGT) - Around 3 hours or so. Maybe a bit more.Storyline Length (TLaD) - Again, around 3 hours or so, or even more.AI (Both games) - Just like in GTA IV, easy to kill, fun to interact with. with your car. Just, brilliant. But they are a tiny bit stupid. 9/10Experience (TBoGT) - You'll have an amazing time playing this! Great intro, great ending, great freemode. 10/10Experience (TLaD) - It's a bit dark, but fun. It had an ok intro, brilliant and satisfying ending, good freemode. 8/10Graphics (TBoGT) - Very nice and full of colour. Very detailed. Loved it. 10/10Graphics (TLaD) - I'd say it had more detail than TBoGT, but it certainly lacked the colour that TBoGT and GTA IV had. I'm not saying it's black and white, it just doesn't have as much colour. Like, the sky is almost always cloudy, the yellow taxis aren't AS yellow. But it's still ok. 7/10Sounds / Voice Acting (TBoGT) - Very nice, the voice acting was brilliant, the car sounds were good, many different radio stations for different radio types. My favourite is Electro Choc. Gun sounds are quite good aswell. 10/10Sounds / Voice Acting (TLaD) - Just like TBoGT, voice acting is great, bike sounds are good, a lot of radio stations, and I think there are other guns which have awesome sounds. 10/10Controls (Both games) - Takes a while to get used to the helicopter, but everything else is just great! 10/10Overall (TBoGT) - 10/10Overall (TLaD) - 9/10These are great games, and I recommend you try it if you haven't already! Isn't much to say here, as I said everything up there. Erm... Enjoy the game, I guess xD

Posted: April 7, 2016
												Once upon a time, there was a brave thief who decided to buy a new dagger. That dagger looked good, was $7, and came in a bundle of 3 daggers for the price of one. The thief bought and opened the bundle and found that the daggers needed to be blessed since it was cursed. Games for Windows Live cursed those daggers and the thief thought of giving up since the creator of these daggers left no cure. Then he came across a blacksmith who looked promising and asked "How do I remove the curse on these daggers?" The blacksmith looked at the thief with a smile on her face and said " Here, use this water. It's called X_Liveless. It should allow you to use those daggers after you placed the water on them." The thief did as the blacksmith said to do. Several minutes later, the thief was able to wield any of the three daggers. Legend says that he who conquers the curse would be able to enjoy the use of weapons. Simply said, Rockstar should have cleaned GTA IV complete edition for Steam to sell. Don't get me wrong, I like the game. It's just that Rockstar should have made a patch, so Steam could take over instead of Games for Windows Live.

content:
Posted: January 15
												DLC-pack for GTA IV with two separate stories : The lost and the Damned - The ballad of Gay Tony. Looking at the play time....is it a DLC ?Installation : unlike with GTA III, Liberty City, San Andreas and GTA IV, installation went smoothly.However, do install GFWL (recent version) yourself.It's a stand-alone pack so no need to have GTA IV installed.Save games : If you have GTA IV installed be aware that the DLC is using the same standard save-game directory as GTA IV and overwrites the GTA IV save games.Story-line : It has references / connections / cameo's of GTA IV characters so best to play GTA IV first.Game quality : simply a top game just like....GTA IV (story-line, characters, graphs, sound, music, humor), what a vibrant lively open world.Maps : same as in GTA IV so Liberty City with Alderney, Broker and AlgonquinBugs : nopeEnd credits of both missions : don't skip them.....contains some fun to watch drone video views about ingame missions like the bank robbery.LOST AND THE DAMNED (LD)Main story : clash of two biker gangs (The lost and the Damned versus The angels of Death) and the internal rival between the members of the LD.Side missions :Races (12) : located across Liberty City, driving a motor bike is challenging and needs some excercise. Equipped with a baseball bat, you can knock other racers from their bike and vice versa.   -> Fun to do and more challenging then the car races in GTAIVGang Wars (25) : located across Liberty City, find and kill all gang members (The angels of Death members or Russians) at a certain map location. Difficulty increases by taking on more missions. You have help from NPC club bike members but don't rely on them........their AI is not that smart. What to think about a gang member throwing a grenade at me or stepping in my line of fire. -> So so, generic missionsBike Thefts (10) : steal bikes and bring them back to your gang club for money-> So so, easy missionsRandom Characters (3) and  their short stories : are displayed on the map with a white icon.-> Fun to doSeagulls (50) : find and kill the sea gulls (no icons on the map)-> Boring brainless excercise, skipped that one. Without a walktrough, it will takeages to find them.Something else : two new standup comedian shows, the mini games 'air hockey' and 'arm wrestling', new radio stations (heavy metal and rock)BALLAD OF GAY TONY (BT) :Main story : You are the bodyguard Vince of Gay Tony, owner of two discotheques and he is in serious debts with the mafia. Did you like :* Brucie in GTA IV, well then you never met his brother Mori* Roman in GTA IV, well it can get worse, meet Arab money Yusuf Amir, loser number one* CJ in GTA San Andreas, you will be playing Vince escaped his hood but sometimes catches up with his homies Henrique and Armando to go on drug  wars* Gay Bernie Crane in GTA IV, please to meet Gay Tony and his coke head lover boy EvanSide missions :Races (3) : A combination of paragliding, steering a speed boat and driving a car-> Fun to doRandom mission (5) : Funny and hilarious encounters, simply enjoyableSeagulls (50) : As in LD, skipped it, pfff, impossible to find them all without help.......Drug wars (25) : Steal the drugs from another gang, drive to the place, kill everyone together with your friends Henrique and Armando, pick up the drugs package, get in a vehicle and drive back to the offload point in car or boat chase style -> so, so  generic missionsBase jumping (15) : Jump from a helicopter or building and paraglide through air checkpoints and land on a ground target or paraglide directly on to a fixed or moving target (boat / truck). Do it the Assassin's creed away -> fun to do.Cage Fighting : Win six rounds, each consisting of three battles against (un)armed opponentsSomething else : doing some surveillance in the discotheque, champagne drinking contest, dancing with the lllladieezzz, drinking shots and going out with friends..

Posted: December 1, 2013
												Might as well make it detailed.Grand Theft Auto: Episodes From Liberty City is bugged, hacked and modded, and it will ALWAYS stay like that. You can't go in a server without getting missing textures, spammed by bullets and explosives, and get modded and crash. The community for EFLC got screwed up, the servers are filled with people with carmods, people fighting cops, people killing each other for no actual reason (in Free Mode, not Deathmatch), and of course, good ol' crashers. If you want to buy it for Multiplayer, get Multi Theft Auto for San Andreas or wait for GTA V PC.Single player, both of the stories are good, but very short, it feels like the game ended really quickly. So if you like GTA because of it's stories, This might not be what you want.So, The game is short, Multiplayer becomes annoying when you see your damn desktop every five minutes, bugs everywhere... Rockstar needs to fix the game (Spoiler Alert: They won't), so, if you buy this game, you should know you'll experience a short story, crashing, and A LOT of rage in Multiplayer.

content:
Posted: February 5
												Liberty City is a one crazy, messed up place with lots of opportunities. EFLC gives GTA IV a revisit in 2 other protagonists' perspective. The characters you play with really distinguish themselves from their peers and they people they work with.While this game is not a big step up from IV, it backs itself up well for being a standalone game (and not a mere DLC). Multiple additions to cars, guns, and recreational activities are just part of the game's added value.Here are the things I liked and disliked about each episode:TLaD+ Biker life - gang wars, hot bikes, gambling, club+ New guns (imagine shooting a sawed-off while riding on a motorcycle)+ New bikes (of course!)- No territorial progression (raiding rival clubhouses and owning them, etc.)- Not enough biker gangs (you have 1 archrival)- Your biker members are all idiots (the AI sucks)- No dating life; lasting relationships purely within the brotherhoodBoGT+ Nightlife and everything nice - clubbing, gay clubs, golden helicopters, golden guns+ New cars (and some of them, fancy!)+ Base jumping+ Gay Tony and Yusuf Amir+ Finally, a tank! (you use it in only 1 mission)- Handling of some cars is a little annoying- Hookups only, dating life nonexistentHere are some of the things I expected, but didn't get, in the game:- Stealth ops (more disguises, suppressed guns)- Winter season (it snows in NY, right?)- The military chasing you at 6 stars- Smarter drivers - they randomly change lanes, do not use their turn lights before doing so. This was a problem in GTA IV that I hoped they were able to solve. I can't believe how many times I failed a mission because of an idiot that decided to change lanes in front of me.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2016
												GTA: Episodes from Liberty City is an expandalone (Standalone Expansion Pack) of GTA IV. They are a two-in-one game, with two sides of one story.On one hand you have The Lost biker gang having gang and family issues, and on the other hand you are Luis Lopez, a part-time bodyguard at Maisonette 9, one of the biggest nightclubs in Liberty City.I will be covering The Ballad of Gay Tony first, as I found it most enjoyable.TBoGT has the most enjoyable missions in any GTA game ever, in my opinion. They are all action packed, interesting and never some sort of escort mission, or "drive there and come back" type of mission. If you've ever played GTA:SA then think of the mission where you board the cargo plane, "Stowaway". Now, multiply that mission about 30 times and you have TBoGT in a nutshell.You get to own interesting and very fun weapons and vehicles such as huge capacity machineguns and... actually I won't spoil any more, I will just say that you will have fun, GUARANTEED, if you have one of those weapons equipped, or you are driving/piloting any of the special, new vehicles. Most of the new vehicles, if not all of them have been copy and pasted into GTA V, as they were too much fun!The story of TBoGT is a bit lacking, but it's enough there to keep you going. The characters in the story, though, are the most crazy and insane in any GTA game ever! There is not one main story cutscene that doesn't involve someone really high on drugs, half-naked or drunk as♥♥♥♥♥♥ You just can't hold in a laugh every time a cutscene rolls!Buuut, here comes the sad and disappointing part of the pack... The Lost and Damned.Now, this might be a bit of a swayed opinion, but The Lost and Damned was just too boring for me. The first initial missions involve you riding with your gang, informing the player about who is who. The leader of the gang just got out of jail and you are picking up his custom bike from the shop. That's the intro, really, and it's a boring, long intro of just driving. The dialogue kinda made up for it, as it was semi-interesting. It is nice to hear the bikers talk to each other when they are in proximity.You still get some extra weapons that you don't get to use in TBoGT, and even some vehicles, but nothing really stands out. There's a sawed-off double barrel shotgun that is incredibly useful at knocking off enemy bikers, as it only needs one pellet to do so, but it's inaccurate as hell and requires you to be at point blank range. I find melee to be more fun at that time. TBoGT has set the bar for that sort of stuff, and TLaD is nowhere near reaching it.If you really enjoyed GTA IV's narrative and atmosphere, you might enjoy TLaD because it is much more slow and story-driven.In the end, it's weird that it was packaged with a much more "mindless fun" type of game as TBoGT.I will rate both parts of the expansions separately, but the game is so cheap now you might as well just buy it for one and have the other as a sort of nice bonus.TLaD: 5/10 - Generally boring, uninteresting, but has its good bits, and come on it's still a GTA game!TBoGT: 9/10 - Definitely takes the cake as it never gets boring until the end of the story.(I have not touched upon the technical issues such as GFWL and such, but there is a mod called x_live_less (remove "_", Steam censors the name for some reason) that removes GFWL and may help you with any issues. I managed to play the game start to finish with GFWL installed and updated no problem, but this may be different for you. Keep in mind Steam refunds are a thing, and do not let this sway you from the purchase of this amazing expandalone!)

												Both of these games are really fun, each narrative has it's advantages and disadvantages, and each one has it's own set of vehicles, characters, cameos and easter eggs. They are both fun 10 hour expansions to the game however I would recommend this soully for the Ballad of Gay Tony DLC.The vehicles and missions are more interesting, there are better side missions and recurring jobs and multiplayer is so much better on account of the cars. The ballad of gay tony has excellent replayability, and is generally hella good fun. The one bad point is even on modern hardware these games are really damn unoptimised on modern hardware and there is nothing we can do about that. On a decent rig expect 60 fps but no more. Even after 8 years however the graphics on these games are stunning.

content:
Posted: March 18, 2015
Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City is a third-person open-world adventure shooter. Play either as Johnny Klebitz, the VP of The Lost biker club, or Luis Fernando Lopez, henchman of Gay Tony, as you strive through the criminal underworld of Liberty City.Pros: This is two full campaigns for Grand Theft Auto IV but doesn't require the original game to run. These are characters that crossed Niko Bellic's path in the original campaign, but their stories happen in parallel to it, allowing you to see who they were, deal with their troubles on their end, giving you a chance to understand events that happened behind the curtains of crimes Niko was involved in. Both are full-fledged story lines of their own, with its own lot of unique characters you come across and gameplay elements. Your new friends brings new perks of their own, and new locations.Cons: You don't have the same feeling of discovery in this game as it's the one as Grand Theft Auto IV, with some locations or stores no longer available. You have a lot less mini-games and side quests, and much if the character customization is gone. There is no major change to the city.Verdict: ★★★☆☆ - It's up to youIt's more of the same, so it's all up to you. If you didn't enjoy Grand Theft Auto IV that much, there is no reason to buy this. However, if you did like GTA4 and wished you could play more campaign mode in Liberty City, these will deliver!—————————————————————————This was just my opinion.If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) reviews.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												A fantastic expansion for GTA4. GTA4 on its own is already a great game, but it was lacking some of the older GTA things that made the series fun. The added some of that into this stand alone expansion pack. The story on both episodes is pretty solid and the missions are fun. The better of the 2 is The Ballad of Gay Tony. It is arguably better than GTA4 in all areas. The missions are more diverse and they even add some of the older GTA missions, for example there is a mission where you get to skydive. These episodes are on sale all the time so I hightly recommend them, I give these episodes a 9/10, lots of extra GTA fun.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Grand Theft Auto: Episode from Liberty City is an Action/Adventure/Open-World game that contains the 2 DLC of Grand Theft Auto IV: The Ballad of Gay Tony and The Lost and Damned. The Ballad of Gay Tony follows the story of the protagonist: Luis Lopez who is the henchman of Gay Tony in a difficult time for the U.S. economy. The Lost and Damned follows the story of the protagonist: Johnny Klebitz who is the Vice-President of the motorcycle club: The Lost. Now let's talk about the multiplayer! The multiplayer of the TLAD is completly dead. If you want to have fun in multiplayer in EFLC, TBOGT is consider as the best multilayer of all the GTA IV games. To play multiplayer you will need: Xbox Live Account (Gold is not required) and a Rockstar Game Social Club Account. For more fun you will need: Simple Native Trainer 6.5 (link below) and ASI loader. Hope this review will help you to make a choice!Links: RGSC: http://socialclub.rockstargames.com/Register to Xbox Live: Xbox.comSimple Native Trainer 6.5: http://www.gta4-mods.com/script/simple-trainer-version-65-f2115ASI Loader: http://www.gta4-mods.com/tools/gta-iv-asi-loader-v1020b-f1976

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												WOW, What a game(s) both being the same but different gameplay mechanics implemented, felt really different of each one.I started with TBOGT, I hated it when the flying missions started and I though they will never end! But I loved them because I'm not going to lie I SUCKED AT FLYING HELICOPTERS! Now I can thanks to this missions! :-D , the Objective Score looks like it was implemented on GTA V after this, that was cool, felt like fresh old optional objectives, really cool tho. I really don't recomend it to people that are really sensitive to terrorism topics, because this "Episode" has a lot of Terrorism on it. TRY AT YOUR OWN RISK (This is only for those kind of people, for the rest you'll enjoy it), the story was filled with a lot of funny moments and how they connect to the base game GTA IV really explains all the events happened that was clever!Then I played TLAD, I really HATED IT at first because you need to follow your gang It was like "caged" because you don't like maybe get orders from a major command? (when you already get them with the missions lol?), anyways I liked the crew system XCOM-like but the best part for me was the CREW HELP! WOAH, I felt really special! because sometimes I really needed help and they where just a call away and I never felt alone, BROTHERS FOREVER! this episode was not funny on the same way as TBOGT, but was SUPER FILLED with action, WARS and SHOOTINGS EVERYWHERE so CRAZEEEEE! was really cool in that aspect. The Objective Score was not in this "Episode", and the bikes where superb but I don't know it felt more shorter for me than TBOGT, maybe because I mostly didn't stopped playing it because it was so good. Both Episodes are brutal and I really enjoyed them, hope to see more like this content on future GTA Titles.Mods used: - RealityIV- Real Gunshots Sounds- Realistic Driving EFLC- Flashlight 4 Weapons- ColAccel- ScriptHook .NET- ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥If you are getting stuck on "No. 3" Mission (TBOGT) after you are going to pull down the cars and after the race cinematics just skip them to avoid freezing on loading, if doesn't load the mission at all enable Vsync or limit the framerate via command line.If you are falling through the ground in TLAD when starting the game and you are using "ColAccel" just delete or rename "colCache.dat" and start the game again.Hope you enjoy it as I did!

												The expansions to Grand Theft Auto IV do nothing to remedy the issues of the original game (see my recommendation for that title). If anything, they are steps downward from the original; they are repetitive, and the characters are difficult to enjoy. The main character from The Lost and the Damned is particularly unlikeable. In sum, these don't add much. They go on sale from time to time for a very affordable price; if you're going to buy them, then buy them at that reduced price.

content:
Posted: October 12, 2014
												Summary: Overall The Ballad of Gay Tony and The Lost and Damned are great standalones with slight improvements to the original GTA 4. Each one offers roughly 5-9 hours of gameplay and new elements such as parachuting, base jumping, mini-games, weapons, and vehicles. 4.5/5.Packaged together, Episodes from Liberty City offer two standalone games that take on very different approaches to the original gameplay in GTA 4. Both offer their own single-player campaigns with roughly 5 hours of missions, mini-games, and a variety of new weapons and vehicles to spice up your experience. The stories, just like the original, are well-written and interweaves with Niko Bellic. Playing the original and then through the episodes will give a second perspective on who did what, where the diamonds came from, and so on. They aren't heavily dependent on knowing the original plot, but they can be better appreciated if you've played through it.The Lost and Damned takes the perspective of Johnny Klebitz, the vice-president of The Lost Motorcycle Club (TLMC). As you would expect, you primarily travel by motorcycle and much of the storyline is around the MC and their conflict with the police, rival gangs, and eventually the mafia.  There is a healthy heaping of new music revolving around the 1% culture, weapons such as the sawn-off shotgun and grenade launcher, and mini-games in the clubhouse such as arm-wrestling and air hockey. One of the big improvements, at least in my eyes, is the use of mid-mission respawns. If you die or fail a mission, restarting it via phone will no longer pull you to the very beginning of the mission. You will probably respawn before the segment where you failed, started. This cuts down on the amount of needless driving when you fail a mission and makes it less of a hassle restarting.The second episode is the Ballad of Gay Tony, which doesn't take you from the perspective of the flamboyantly gay Tony Prince (whom you may have noticed in Niko's story), but his bodyguard and partner Luis Lopez. If TLAD focused on motorcycles, it's safe to say that TBGT focused on helicopters, base jumping, parachuting, and night clubs. Again, TBGT's plot is interwoven into the original plot and fleshes out much of the why's and how's of that story. As with TLAD, there's almost a good half-dozen new mini-games, such as golf, dancing, drinking, parachuting, and races. If you had a hard time with the helicopter controls, then bad news, about 1/4 of the missions require piloting a helicopter at some point. Generally the storyline is well-written, the characters are great with Yusuf, the playboy millionaire Arab, Mori, the bodybuilding dwarf with a God complex, and Bulgarin, the Russian mobster collecting American rock memoribilia. The characters drive the storyline well and leaves the game with a satisfying conclusion.Overall the game improves on a few issues from the original, but there are still a few things that hamper your gaming experience. Controls are still finicky, with driving still painful (you'll come to hate motorcycles on the final TBGT mission), flight controls difficult, and shooting still frustrating at times. It'll put a smile on your face when you see an NPC struggle to get in and out of a vehicle, but make you cringe when your characters' pathing causes him to dart back-and-forth around a vehicle. Mission restart has been improved, maybe some way of fast-travel would make driving less of a burden but I'm sure they want the playtime to be buffed higher by needless traveling. In summary, it's a strong buy and I highly recommend the game, I think that if you especially like the original then you'll find enjoyment with the episodes. 4.5/5.

content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
												EFLC is an amazing standalone DLC for GTA IV. Both storylines are action-packed fun (TLAD + TBoGT). Both begin with a bang, meeting the characters in a way. In TBoGT you start off in a cutscene where you're on the ground, and there are Irish brothers robbing a bank. It has a great sense of humour at times and has references to GTA IV itself (most of them are not spoilers, just showing the characters like Niko drive past or Roman at a club. TLAD starts off with a bang, where you are the Co-Leader of a Motorcycle Club. You get him back & then get his bike back.Good stuff. Another thing, the missions in EFLC have a lot more action in them compared to IV's in my opinion.If you do decide to get this, good luck out there. LC is one dangerous placeOh and, might wanna get yourself a GFWL and Rockstar Social Club account while you're game is downloading/installing. It'll help.

content:
Posted: March 10, 2014
												Double the story, double the fun! This DLC actually contains two stories: you play as Johnny and also as Luis. Both stories take place in Liberty City and should be launched separately. Lost of The Damned felt a bit boring as the game put too much emphasis on the use of motorbikes. So, after a while I hated I couldn't really get into a car but Luis's story compensated me for that.There isn't much to say about these two stories. Everything is identical to the things we got used to in GTA IV. Perhaps, many of the missions seems a bit more over the top but it only increased the fun for me.Putting the bad optimisation aside this is a damn fine DLC. If you liked the original game you'll like this one, too.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2016
												GTA Episodes from Liberty City is a collection of the 2 GTA 4 expansions: "The Lost and Damned" and "The Ballad of Gay Tony". Almost everything i had to say about the original GTA 4 also applies here, since the expansion are basically additional story missions with 2 new protagonists and some new additions. The story of the episodes has the same quality as the original, and they interwine in a cohesive way. TLAD is bike-focused, and TBoGT has new mechanics that will remind you of San Andreas. The missions are more varied too. The map is the same, but the soundtrack is new. It is shorter, but i enjoyed it more than the original. And TBoGT finally introduces a replay mission feature, with optional objectives to complete. The PC related issues are also the same. So, if you enjoyed GTA 4, you'll definitely enjoy this compilation.

TBoGT's atmosphere is dance music oriented, but missions are awful. i mean 80% of TBoGT missions are totally unrealistic (destroy a huge crane in city center, destroy a yacht 2 km from the coast, steal a subway with an helo..). in TLaD, atmosphere is metal rock, metamphet sh### and broken showers.if you encounter problems with the game launching, it's most of the time caused by obsolete Games for Windows thing. search on the net a tutorial that explains how to install things and in which order, and it should work fine

												WOW! there is no other words to describe this game the story for both The Lost and Damned and The Ballad of Gay Tony are fantastic instead of going through the game as Niko Bellic this time you play as two new characters that were seen in the normal GTA IV game but not playable the two new characters Luis Lopez and Johnny Klebitz stories in the game are very interesting and will hook people in immediately. Still retaining the features from GTA IV The Lost and Damned and The Ballad of Gay Tony both add new features in the game that can only be used when playing EFLC for example The Ballad of Gay Toy adds parachutes to the game so now you can go and jump off the empire state building and not die when you hit the ground. Like in GTA IV you still explore Liberty City just this time you can access places that could not be accessed in GTA IV. Like I said the story for both games really will hook you in like GTA IV's story hooked me in when I first played the game both games adds up to about 80 hours of gameplay which will keep people entertained throughout both games. So if you're looking to buy a GTA game I really really recommend you get GTA IV and GTA EFLC they are both very enjoyable games and they will both blow you away without a doubt!.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												Episodes from Liberty City é um pacote com as duas expansões de GTA 4, inicialmente lançadas separadamente, sendo que podem ser jogadas mesmo sem possuir o jogo de base. Ambas trazem pequenas variações no mapa em relação ao original e algumas pequenas novidades.O primeiro episódio, The Lost and Damned, diz respeito a uma gangue de motoqueiros que teve seu líder (Billy Grey) capturado pela polícia. Até que ele pudesse retornar, a gangue passou a ser comandada por Johnny Klebitz que guiou seus companheiros à prosperidade.No entanto, anos se passaram e com o retorno de Billy, ele estava totalmente transformado de forma que sua liderança estava destruindo tudo que havia sido construído e pondo em risco seus membros. Esta situação faz com que alguns dos membros se revoltem.Nesta expansão, o jogador controla Johnny, que por sinal se movimenta muito devagar, bem mais devagar que Nicko. Como há um maior foco em motocicletas, foram acrescentados alguns modelos novos e tornou-se praticamente impossível cair delas.Uma coisa ruim é que as vozes dos motoqueiros não combinam com os personagens e nos faz ter dificuldade de saber quem é quem está falando, o que prejudica um pouco o entendimento dos diálogos.Já o segundo episódio, The Ballad of Gay Tony, assumimos o papel de Luis Lopez, braço direito de Tony Prince, um viadinho dono das melhores boates em Liberty City. Luis é sócio de Tony e eles são apenas amigos, sendo que não há nenhuma outra relação entre eles.Diferente dos outros personagens, Luis vive na vida boa, tem um bom apartamento e várias mulheres. O problema é que o negócio das boates já não está tão lucrativo como antes, e seu mentor Tony se meteu em algumas enrascadas tentando diversificar os investimentos.The Ballad of Gay Tony tem as melhores músicas tocando nas rádios contando todos os GTA’s já lançados, pelo menos na minha opinião, além de missões frenéticas e um sistema de pontuação por missão que premia o jogador em realiza-las usando métodos específicos.Há nas duas expansões algumas adições muito bem vindas, como um sistema de checkpoints nas missões em que, no caso de falha, o jogador não precisa repetir a missão desde o começo, mas sim do último checkpoint.Também foram adicionados novos mini games, como queda de braço e competição de bebida, corridas com bastões e habilidade para dançar. Foi retirada (felizmente) a necessidade de ficar ligando para as pessoas para manter relacionamentos.O interessante é que as tramas das expansões ocorrem paralelamente a do jogo principal, sendo que por várias vezes passamos pelo mesmo local onde ocorreu algum evento e podemos ver os personagens dos outros jogos realizando as ações que fizemos, quando estávamos jogando com eles.Além disso, as histórias são interligadas, com várias referencias cruzadas, e há situações em que realizaremos missões  com a participação dos personagens dos outros jogos, o que nos ajuda a entender melhor qual o que ocorreu em cada evento.Algo que já acontecia no GTA 4 original, mas agora é muito frequente é o recebimento de alguma ligação que faz iniciar uma missão qualquer... Isso é muito chato porque não há como não aceitar e você deverá fazer aquela missão compulsoriamente naquele momento, mesmo que tivesse em mente fazer outra coisa.Não se pode deixar de mencionar que também foram herdados alguns bugs do título principal, mas pelo menos são bem menos numerosos, e não atrapalham tanto jogar como eram naquele, de forma que não há quase nada para reclamar do jogo.No fim das contas, se você jogou GTA 4, é praticamente obrigatório que você jogue suas expansões também, pois são bastante sólidas e talvez até mais divertidas que o título principal. EXCELENTE (9/10).

Posted: July 14, 2014
												It's hard to NOT reccomend EFLC. I mean yes, it still has some glaring issues from its brother, GTA 4, such as the just rather grey and depressing Liberty City (and TLaD doesn't do much to fix this, especially when it adds that grainy filter), the PC port (which I'll talk about more later) is still random, sometimes it will run great, other times it's like playing a slide show, and all of it varies from PC to PC. I've seen fixes that helped improve performance for some by 20 frames, and then when I try it it does nothing to the performance. But overall, you're getting a very solid package with EFLC.TLaD:This expansion in my opinion has the stronger story of the two, but the weaker world. You are "Johnny the Jew" part of a biker gang that has been on the fall since its peak in the 60s. The leader of your bike gang begins to go crazy with power, and starts a war with the AoD (Angels of Death), and as you can imagine, chaos ensues. I'm going to leave the story off from that since as I said it really is quite the ride, and if you liked GTA 4's story you'll really enjoy TLaD as Rockstar really managed to combine the stories quite well with several crossovers from Niko. This was the first game in a long time that I sat down and beat the story in one sitting, it really is that good in my opinion.However, if you DON'T like GTA 4's focus on story and grim approach, TLaD probably isn't for you. Now, that's not to say if you didn't like Niko's story you won't like Johnny's, as they are quite different, but Johnny's story is still very grim compared to other GTA stories (not to say it doesn't have its share of laugh out loud moments and some absurdity thrown in there). But if you're expecting this to bring the insanity of GTA:SA combined with a ton of unique side missions, TLaD is not for you. The only notable side missions include a new race mode with bikes and you now have the option to hit oppenents with bats to throw them off course, and a "gang wars" side mission which is cool on paper, with X-COM style mechanics in the sense that the more you use a gang memeber with out them dying the better they become in battle, but when they die that's it, they're dead and you have to start all over again with a new memeber. But the AI is just not good enough to make it worth your time, and often my team mates would die from a bomb I threw at a car that my team mates are trying to ram, no matter how hard I try to get them to get away. Also there are only like 5 scenarios that just repeat through out the 25 side missions, and only a few lines of dialogue that the characters just repeat over and over again. You do get some guns from doing it, but if you've already beaten the story, chances are you have a ton of ammo for these guns already.Overall I give TLaD a 8/10:Pros:Great StoryGreat mechanicsSome fun new toysOverall solid expereinceGreat Voice ActingCons:World feels lackingGrainy filter makes the game look ugly and even more washed outTBoGT:This expansion without a shadow of a doubt is one that every fan of the GTA series should play. The story, while not as strong as TLaD, wraps up many, if not all lose ends from GTA 4 and TLaD. The world is great fun with loads of side missions that will keep you busy for hours and hours. And you get some fantastic toys that brings back some of that absurdity many loved from GTA:SA.You are Luis Lopez, a former criminal who was involved with a lot of drug dealing in Northern Algonquin, but has since moved to Downtown Algonquin and changed his life around. He's now making a lot more money, works night clubs, and is the body guard of Tony Prince (Gay Tony) a once big shot going through a mid-life crisis, threatened by the closing of his night clubs under a new law in Liberty City, and he owes money to just about every major gang in Liberty City...I think you see where this is going. So through a 6-8 hours long story you'll go from blowing up cranes, highjacking trains, and riding planes. It truly is a fun time with some of the best missions in the GTA 4 trilogy. Also, the start of this expansion is in my opinion the best of the series. TBoGT also has a fantastic world, and in my opinion is more engaging than even GTA 4's. You have fight night matches, an awesome racing mode that has you jump out of a helicopter, land in a boat, then drive to a car, and race in the cars which also have nitrous, it really is fun. On top of that you have club managment which is...so-so it's rather boring as you just watch over the crowd for a few minutes but every time you do it you get a mission from some celeberity at the end of your shift, this ranges from simply escorting them from paparazzi to spraying people down with a fire truck, it feels very familiar to the wackiness in Saints Row 2, which is definitly not a bad thing. You also get base jumping side missions, which are really fun. You'll be jumping out of helicopters, off of buildings, and off of motorcycles mid-air, and it feels very similar to GTA:SA. And finally, you get some "Drug War" missions, which are very similar to the "Gang Wars" from TLaD, the only difference being they got rid of the X-COM mechanics and instead of just killing everyone, you normally have a goal to steal the "product" and cash and get it to a safe location without it blowing up or you dying. It's fun for the first few times, but just like the gang wars  it's really just like 5 scenarios repeated and the dialogue begins repeating.TBoGT will pretty much appeal to anyone that has liked a GTA game in the past, and in my opinion that's fantastic.Overall I give TBoGT a 10/10. Must play.The overall package is fantastic, and well worth your money. Rockstar did it again. PC PERFORMANCE:Yeah, so I'm going to be frank here, if you don't have a decent PC in TODAY standards, you may want to consider getting this on console. Now-a-days the game is so cheap on both platforms it's worth getting the PC version anyways just to mess around with mods, even if the game doesn't run so hot for you. But on my 660 and i5-3470 rig this game runs very poor, especially for its age and the visuals. The frame-drops in the game are just really strange, I've gone from 140fps in one second to 30 in the next, it's just all over the place, and I STRONGLY reccomend putting V-sync on to stop this, even though V-sync locks the fps at 55...seriously what the heck were you thinking Rockstar? Oh yeah, and the benchmark is pointless, unlike other games like Metro: LL where the benchmark pushes your PC to the limit and you'll never encounter that heavy of a load in game, the benchmark is really easy on your PC and I get almost double the fps average in the benchmark than I do in game... There are some fixes out there that are worth a try but I couldn't find one that worked for me. Also if you have more than 2GB of Vram the game won't let you change the settings (there are some fixes to this, just google it). And on top of it all, this game uses not ONE, not TWO, but THREE DRM services...including GFWL...yeah.So the PC port is pretty abysmal I must say, and I hope Rockstar treats the PC version of GTA V with more care (they better, considering how long we've waited). That being said, if you have the PC to run it well, this is WAY better looking than the console version, especially now that the shadows actually look like shadows and not blobs! And there are some cool PC exclusive features like your own radio station that plays your own songs, some improved animations, and the ability to save video clips and edit them together. Also, if you're like me and had a XBL account GFWL isn't all bad, as you can still get into private chats with people using the XB1 and 360, so that's sorta neat.

Posted: December 30, 2012
												Grand Theft Auto Episodes from Liberty City gives you two side stories to the main game, and tries to fix a lot of gripes people had with it. The Ballad of Gay Tony in particular was clearly an attempt at Rockstar getting back it's lost fanbase.The stories are interesting and the parallels to the main game fitting in places. However more then that they are a decent length. GTA4 made you feel it's length very often. The storyline felt really overly lengthy for such a small amount of things actually accomplished. In both of these episodes the storylines are tighter and more constrained. Not that it's a bad thing after all, they actually feel a lot more polished as a result.I recommend getting these if you already liked GTA4 but chances are, if you didn't like GTA4 you're most likely not going to buy these anyway.

Posted: March 5, 2014
												I can't recommend this game for PC.Is the game itself good? Yes, without a doubt.The problem is that the PC version is one of the worst ports you'll ever find.I had several problems that prevented me from even starting the game. I can't actually start the game via steam because I have to manually run the "LaunchEFLC.exe" file as administrator for it to actually start, or I will receive an error.I was also unable to edit anny graphics options due to a deliberate barrier set up to prevent you from changing the graphics if your PC is weak. Problem is, it also happens when your GPU has more than 2GB of VRAM.Last but not least, the game would automatically crash because I hadn't installed and patched Games For Windows Live.Even after I got it to work, there are still plenty of gameplay-related issues. Also, the framerate is unacceptable with my specs considered, and it even manages to crash to desktop now and then.TL;DR: Get it for your console if you can instead.

content:
Posted: June 16, 2016
												IV's engine was insane for it's time, and the soundtrack is so damn good as in any GTA. This engine is WAY more fun than GTA V. Play this with CryenbV3 it is a different game, it's GTA 4.5. Euphoria Natural Motion is so damn good in this it's incredible.. PC version has alternative radio stations as well as the console ones although it leaves a few to Niko's side. Most deep satired adverts out of any GTA game and the mmost varied music. Clubs are classic. Liberty city is nicely populated,  attention to detail is extremely impressive for its time. Natural motion and rigid body car physics that left huge dents, (unlike V). People go into a dynamic reaction that still wows me. What other game can you go around in that uses natural motion like this? The answer is absolutely none other, GTA V only has it sometimes and same as the cars, and it's extremely toned down from the natural motion on the people to the skeletons of them being rigid. Plus you can't get Red Dead properly for PC. Max Payne 3 has it but isn't free roam. (Got GTA IV on disc and have enb ICE1040) Best of all about this game is it's natural-motion reaction physics.

Posted: May 28, 2016
												First of all, I must say that the game needs an unofficial patch to run. Now lets go to the game itself: **The lost and damned analysis only** The mecanics are all the same of GTA IV, the difference is that this game has more bikes and other story. So: Bikes: There are more choppers, they dont really add mutch to the game. They are not satisfactory to drive, and the game forces you to do it un half of the missions. History: At first I didnt like it, I mean, there is nothing interesting at the beginning. After certain important point in the history, it starts to be good: New characters are added, and the whole game starts make sense, but when I really started to enjoy the game, it abruptly ended. Launch time was over maybe? We will never know In summary: Do I recommend this game? Yes It was Good? The last 15% of the history was good. On the other hand, it is horribly optimized, and needs a patch to run, so buy it only on sale

Posted: February 1, 2015
												Ok, Rockstar you released this game nearly 5 years ago and when this game was first announced i♥♥♥♥♥♥my pants i couldnt believe that i could not only return to liberty city but also could play two different stories as gta 4 was a little lame.., it still had its charm though ,but i digress, this game is awesome, why? well not only are graphics better (well sorta) but has a way better story arch, new weapons and some returning weapons from gta 4 ,way better missions and better characters. Each story represents the different difficulties for instance GTA: TLAD is for more beginner types whereas GTA: TBOGT is for more experienced players the missions are far more difficult and provides plenty of challenge..., as for gameplay its overall the same as GTA IV accept the addition of new running animations of the characters and a few new vehicles however theres one particular vehicle and weapon that tops them all of course ill let you find out but its awesome,,,now for the mods..oh my, there are hundrends upon thousands of free mods for this game and not to mention there are so many modding websites dedicated to this game but my final verdict for this game is a 8/10 the game could have had a higher score if rockstar didnt use the same formula from GTA IV and added new gameplay styles like being arrested which is in fact a long awaited feature....you know?

												First of all, I must say that the game needs an unofficial patch to run. Now lets go to the game itself: **The lost and damned analysis only** The mecanics are all the same of GTA IV, the difference is that this game has more bikes and other story. So: Bikes: There are more choppers, they dont really add mutch to the game. They are not satisfactory to drive, and the game forces you to do it un half of the missions. History: At first I didnt like it, I mean, there is nothing interesting at the beginning. After certain important point in the history, it starts to be good: New characters are added, and the whole game starts make sense, but when I really started to enjoy the game, it abruptly ended. Launch time was over maybe? We will never know In summary: Do I recommend this game? Yes It was Good? The last 15% of the history was good. On the other hand, it is horribly optimized, and needs a patch to run, so buy it only on sale

Posted: September 21, 2016
												Well, I don't really know how I should review this game nowadays, because back then when I've played I didn't have to endure any kind of problem involving the MSN Live's network. Either way, those two games in one were like the best expansion pack that I've ever played in a long time. In one of those stories you get to control this guy who owns a night club and has a partnership with this gay guy. As for the other one, you assume the role of the leader of a bikers gang. There's not really much diversity compared to the original game, but these two different stories certainly add something else to the whole spectrum. I also read in some reviews that people were having to deal with some crashes, I also had to deal with this really annoying one that would happen everytime during this mission that involved a train (The Ballad of Gay Tony). I don't really know how I actually managed to pass that, it must've been some sort of miracle but in the end everything worked out, so I'm giving everything a thumbs up.

Posted: July 10, 2016
												Might Help Some one Few Tweaks to help u get past the Social club log in error, go to game folder change paul.dll  to paul.dll.disabled If your video card  is above 2gb memory create notepad named commandline inside gamefolder[steam-steamApps-common-gtaivepisodesfromlibertycity-EFLC]copy these into notepad -availablevidmem "4.0"-percentvidmem "100"  -nomemrestrict -norestrictionssave it & close the notepad,  start the game it should work fine now, game wont restrict to change your resolution or settings even though warning appears there is not enough memory also game seems to have terrible AA turn on FXAA in nvidia control panel. PS:i got same issues when i started GTA IV couldnt log in to social club or change settings because vram is above 2gb, these  tweaks helped me get past those, game works fine now. Though game is fun  ports are terrible and R* still didnt get rid of the GFWL client.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2011
												Developers, take note. This is how you create DLC. Two episodes that span around 15 hours of gameplay (more if you're going to do everything). It feels like a whole new game. Yes, the city is still the same, but the stories aren't and the missions are quite diverse. One thing I really liked was the fact that all important characters are in a way part of the other characters' stories. The graphics and details are still awesome to this day (and the faces could still use some work). The missions from The Lost And Damned (and the story itself) aren't as much fun when compared to The Ballad Of Gay Tony. The missions in Gay Tony range from racing to stealing and basejumping. There's also a few helicopter missions. Flying a helicopter is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥though, and it's one of the things I really hate. But that can be overlooked. This game is great ! Recommended ![Rating: 92/100]
