content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												It's GTA IV, but with more fluid game mechanics. What you probably want to hear is whether it's worth getting, whether it fills the gap until GTA 5 hits the shelves. So in a word, yes. In two words, sort of.The game engine is still the GTA IV engine, of course; don't expect any dramatic changes between GTA IV and Episodes From Liberty City (EFLC). The only discernible differences are better driving (motorbikes! yay!) and cover taking mechanics, as well as slightly better AI and new radio content. The graphics are still the same ones that taxed the hell outta all our PC's back when IV was released; this old engine seems to have been optimized quite a bit since then, even if the physics are still a bit buggy in large scale explosions or bridge traffic pileups (yup, they still periodically do that weird stacking thing on the bridge). The AI as mentioned before has better cover taking, especially when in a firefight with allies. But, when♥♥♥♥♥♥gets real, you'll quickly realise that the AI can't handle certain things. There were moments in my playthrough where i'd be in a firefight and just move myself behind a solid object that i could still fire over or around, and find myself then being able to systematically slaughter any bot that had the temerity to walk into my fireline. The soundtrack to the game is pretty decent. The LC Rock station with Iggy Pop in particular was to my mind the best thing about the Radio stations. There's a fair few gems in the limited new content the radio stations get, but after a while you'll probably find yourself adding your own music just to keep things fresh.The storyline is alright; it fills in gaps between key events in Niko Bellic's story. In terms of the quality of the storytelling it's more or less your usual GTA fare. Lots of violence, swearing, racism, homophobia and misogyny coupled with explosions, gun fights and chase sequences. EFLC is just as cheesy, offensive and satirical as GTA has ever been, so if that's your bag you're in for a fun, nostalgic ride through that familiar virtual cesspit that is Liberty City.To summarise, there's nothing really *new* here, and whilst it's certainly a lot of fun revisiting LC through the eyes of two very different characters, after the 30 or so hours of gameplay it takes to rinse through it all, you can't help but feel like it was fun, but you've done it all before. You'll almost certainly find yourself very quickly forgetting the characters and their stories, but at least you'll have enjoyed the process.Overall: 3.5/5 Audio: 3/5Graphics: 3/5Gameplay: 4/5Nothing groundbreaking, revisits a lot of old ground, but it's still an exciting sojourn through a living, breathing city.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												While I hated GTA4, Episodes was actually WAY better.The controls, driving, and some of the visuals are still crap, as well as the car limit and being infected with GFWL, but there were actually some improvements in a few areas.Both extra campaigns each added some new and improved weapons, which added to the fun factor.The Lost and Damned was focused around being a biker, and as a result made the game a lot more interesting. The choppers are some of the better handing vehicles in the game, and there was almost always at least one around, and so you never had to drive one of those 4 wheeled icy marshmellows commonly known as 'cars' in GTA4 unless you REALLY wanted to.In addition to having your trusty gang deliver a bike to you whenever you wanted, you could also call them for backup, either just for fun, or to help you out on a difficult mission. Successfully completing missions leveled your gang members up, actually making them even more useful.Lost was definitely the most enjoyable version of GTA4 for me. Probably because it felt a little more like Saints Row.The Ballad of Gay Tony wasn't quite as good as Lost, mostly because you were back to reliance on cars for most of your traveling and didn't have the option of backup whenever you wanted. But it DID have the explosive shotgun.And dancing. Don't ask me why the dancing was so fun. Maybe because the rest of the gameplay was so meh.Getting a dance-off going at the Hercules was probably the best part of the episode.Each episode was around 10 hours for mostly the story missions, but they felt a lot more fun overall. While you still got calls to hang out every so often, it wasn't nearly as bad as GTA4.There also weren't as many difficult missions as there were in GTA4, and there were much more plentiful checkpoints in the ones that were difficult.While Episodes still shares a lot of problems with GTA4, if you REALLY want to play a GTA4 game, I'd recommend just playing Episodes from Liberty City. There will be a few plot holes, but who's playing a GTA game for plot?

content:
Posted: June 11, 2014
												This needed A LOT of internet searching and fixing to get it run on my Windows 8.1:- Install Games for Windows Live- Set the main EXE-file to run in Vista Service Pack 2 compatibility mode- Manually add a registry key to tell the system where the game files are installed, for example: [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Rockstar Games\EFLC]"InstallFolder"="D:\\spiele\\steam\\SteamApps\\common\\Grand Theft Auto IV Episodes from Liberty City\\EFLC"So, if you are not a nerd wanting to spend some time searching how to get this thing working, installing extra stuff, and hacking in the registry, this is not for you.It still crashes when quitting the game, but at least it now finally runs.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												GTA: EFLC is more of a game pack that consists of 2 games, GTA: The Lost and Damned, and GTA: The Ballad of Gay Tony.GTA: TLADYou play as a biker called Johnny, and the game has many interesting activities/missions, activities like Arm Wrestling, Pool (I think), Darts and more. The multiplayer has some gamemodes that might be more interesting than Free Roam (will talk more about it on TBOGT), yet I haven't played them because the multiplayer is dead pretty much.GTA:TBOGTYou play as Luis Lopez, a guy who works for a man named Tony (Nickname: Gay Tony). The game is generally better in terms of visuals and more fun things to do. In terms of visuals, TBOGT did a good job of removing the annoying color thing that makes the game more grey like in GTA IV. TBOGT has activities, just like TLAD, but there's one that isn't seen in other GTA games (I think). Cage fighting. It's basically you fighting against some people, or you can spectate and bet your money on who you think is gonna win. When you fight, each round you fight against 3 different people, there's 5-6 rounds in total. And now the Multiplayer. It's a pretty fun experience, Free Roam and the other gamemodes maybe too. I like Free Roam, because it lets you do atleast one activity that you can't do in other GTA IV games (normal IV and TLAD), that's parachuting. It's fun if you find a way to do stuff like:Actual parachutingDying in the best way possibleStart the sky diving thing, fall and have a low chance of living (from the top of a building), it also has uses for free running, too. Free running is pretty fun if you find the places to do so. They are commonly found near parachuting locations, or other buildings in the game (Lots of them are enterable, and I think most of them can give access to a rooftop). Now, you might be wondering, how can sky diving possibly help? Here's the answer. Without a parachute on, you couldn't really jump far. While with one on, you could start the sky diving which lets you travel further distances, for example that one stair case that's in the opposite building. Overall, it's a fun experience, both singleplayer and multiplayer.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												GTA: EFLC is more of a game pack that consists of 2 games, GTA: The Lost and Damned, and GTA: The Ballad of Gay Tony.GTA: TLADYou play as a biker called Johnny, and the game has many interesting activities/missions, activities like Arm Wrestling, Pool (I think), Darts and more. The multiplayer has some gamemodes that might be more interesting than Free Roam (will talk more about it on TBOGT), yet I haven't played them because the multiplayer is dead pretty much.GTA:TBOGTYou play as Luis Lopez, a guy who works for a man named Tony (Nickname: Gay Tony). The game is generally better in terms of visuals and more fun things to do. In terms of visuals, TBOGT did a good job of removing the annoying color thing that makes the game more grey like in GTA IV. TBOGT has activities, just like TLAD, but there's one that isn't seen in other GTA games (I think). Cage fighting. It's basically you fighting against some people, or you can spectate and bet your money on who you think is gonna win. When you fight, each round you fight against 3 different people, there's 5-6 rounds in total. And now the Multiplayer. It's a pretty fun experience, Free Roam and the other gamemodes maybe too. I like Free Roam, because it lets you do atleast one activity that you can't do in other GTA IV games (normal IV and TLAD), that's parachuting. It's fun if you find a way to do stuff like:Actual parachutingDying in the best way possibleStart the sky diving thing, fall and have a low chance of living (from the top of a building), it also has uses for free running, too. Free running is pretty fun if you find the places to do so. They are commonly found near parachuting locations, or other buildings in the game (Lots of them are enterable, and I think most of them can give access to a rooftop). Now, you might be wondering, how can sky diving possibly help? Here's the answer. Without a parachute on, you couldn't really jump far. While with one on, you could start the sky diving which lets you travel further distances, for example that one stair case that's in the opposite building. Overall, it's a fun experience, both singleplayer and multiplayer.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
												I most enjoyed this title even though it was on the same map as GTA4 it had so much to offer!!PROS:✔ Sick story telling with huge amounts of humor. Man I will never get bored of some of the hilarious moments during dialogues and cinematics while doing quests.✔ They kept the radio stations interesting. Indeed they did! Loved the talkshows. Loved the commercials. Loved that they kept the independence radio station system. And totally loved the hilariousness included in each dialogue, comment or ad in them as should be in a predecessor of the GTA cult!✔ Interesting script. Especially loved the The Ballad of Gay Tony. I first played the tBoGT and afterwards I played tLaD campaign. I enjoyed it. And I totally loved how nicely they both blend in the exact same world in the exact same timing.✔ Loved the little crossovers here and there with Niko from GTA4.✔ Absolutely awesome quality and quantity of weapons!✔ Insane attention to details by the devs. From the graphical effects of dust and dirt on surfaces down to pedestrian AIs and material and texture design. The city looks live and real. Hell, even the music and sound effects are more realistic! Even braking the glass of a car's window affects the music volume from the car radio!!✔ Awesome voice acting as expected from a GTA game.✔ Awesome water and sea dynamics. It felt so natural and relaxing driving a boat, even if it was a really slow one.CONS:✖ Terrible follower AI. Their combat tactics and driving skills were a complete disaster. They kept getting in the way many times during battles. They drive like freakin psychopaths on crack even if you drive like a 70yo lady.✖ I was expecting a way better lip sync.✖ Inexcusable rendering mistakes from various city locations. Invisible walls or flooring and pavement textures. They are not many. But they shouldn't really exist. I mean they did put down so much detail in so many other things and some of the graphical bugs are so hard to miss it makes you think they were too bored to care fixing them.✖ WHY THE HELL DO YOU FORCE US TO PUT UP WITH THAT PIECE OF SH*T GAMES FOR WINDOWS LIVE INTERFACE? F*cking Hell it♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me off all the time!! App runs like a freakin faulty spyware! Can't get rid of it, eating up space and bandwidth. Kept disconnecting all the freakin time and totally bugged out 90% of my checkpoint auto-save games (it actually kept informing me that I already had the checkpoint savegames from quests I was doing for the first time!). WTH dudes?!? Is't the Rockstar Games Social Club app enough for middleware launch and you also had to add the buggy as f*ck Games For Windows Live interface too? WHY?Heard that GTA5 won't be having it.... Thank God!MIXED:☢ Some face expressions needed a bit work done. They made a great effort bringing realism in all characters plain NPC citizents included. But then you get to see some hideous face expressions from women when dancing with them at the club. Or seeing yoru character having the same angry face expression through the game even if all the action is hours (ingame) past the moment.☢ I really wish we could dive underwater...☢ I needed more collectibles.FINAL VERDICT:I enjoyed the game a whole lot, so much that I was able to put aside all the negatives or mixed feelings during gameplay that I would totally recommend this game.I'm giving it a 8/10. For me personally it could had been higher if it wasn't for the irritating Games For Windows Live interface.it's a good enjoyable game worth spending time on. If your PC can handle it and haven't played it yet please do.Totally worth buying on special offers.

content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												This game should absolutely not be for sale in it's current state. Here is a list of steps that I had to take to run the game once. (Since quitting that one session I have been unable to load the game a second time.) Once installed, clicking 'play' did nothing. No GTA, no error messages either. Upon consulting Google, I downloaded and installed Games for Windows Live. (Hasn't this been discontinued? Why is this even still available?) After installing and attempting to launch the game, I was presented with an error message. Progress! Error 'Seculauncher failed to start application [2000].' After more Googling, running the .exe as an administrator solved this problem. I'm finally in the game! Oh, the resolution is stuck at 800x600. I'll just change that. I can't. Great. After more Googling, I have to create a text file (commandline.txt) in the game directory and add the following parameters: '-nomemrestrict -norestrictions'. Apparently this is because I have TOO MUCH video memory on my laptop. I can't add these as launch parameters within Steam because I'm having to launch the game as an administrator from the game directory each time. Holy crap, I managed to change the resolution! And I'm in the game! Awesome! Time for a break. I'll just close this game and reopen it later. Okay, I'm back. GTA, here I come! Oh, now the loading screen just loops infinitely. Wonderful. Back to Google. Apparently this problem is also related to having too much video memory. Except the launch parameters I added should have already solved it. I give up.Stay away from this. It's a wreck.

content:
Posted: March 24, 2015
												I can't recommend this game for the same reasons I can't recommend GTA IV.  Here's a link to that one if you're interested.  I'm in no way endorsing or encouraging piracy, and I think everyone should support worthwhile developers by purchasing their games and products. That's just a disclaimer because what I'm about to say may actually get me banned. Pirates literally have an easier time playing these games (and other select titles from Rockstar) due to GFWL's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t DRM. If you have a Live account and want to be able to play your saved games WHENEVER YOU WANT, just like you would be able to with the console versions of this game, you're♥♥♥♥♥♥out of luck. You'll have to make an offline profile to do that, which means you won't be able to play with your friends or show off your achievements to them, but I guess you can't have everything with Rockstar. If you were expecting save files to work the way they should, that is, saved locally and available to you WHENEVER, AT ANY TIME, EVEN WHEN YOU'RE NOT CONNECTED TO THE INTERNET, you should look elsewhere, because you won't find any of that common sense here. When your game, through sheer always-online DRM ♥♥♥♥ery, makes it easier for pirates to play the game than PAYING ♥♥♥♥ING CUSTOMERS WHO DOLED OUT THEIR HARD EARNED MONEY EXPECTING A PRODUCT THAT JUST ♥♥♥♥ING WORKS THE WAY IT SHOULD IN RETURN, you have FAILED. Failed MISERABLY, in fact. And that save file ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to GFWL's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. It isn't just Rockstar games, either. Any game that uses GFWL is full of issues that are usually directly caused by it. A good general rule of thumb is to just avoid any game that has, or has ever had, GFWL integrated into it. You'll be setting yourself up for failure and disappointment, not necessarily in that order.

content:
Posted: March 24, 2015
												I can't recommend this game for the same reasons I can't recommend GTA IV.  Here's a link to that one if you're interested.  I'm in no way endorsing or encouraging piracy, and I think everyone should support worthwhile developers by purchasing their games and products. That's just a disclaimer because what I'm about to say may actually get me banned. Pirates literally have an easier time playing these games (and other select titles from Rockstar) due to GFWL's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t DRM. If you have a Live account and want to be able to play your saved games WHENEVER YOU WANT, just like you would be able to with the console versions of this game, you're♥♥♥♥♥♥out of luck. You'll have to make an offline profile to do that, which means you won't be able to play with your friends or show off your achievements to them, but I guess you can't have everything with Rockstar. If you were expecting save files to work the way they should, that is, saved locally and available to you WHENEVER, AT ANY TIME, EVEN WHEN YOU'RE NOT CONNECTED TO THE INTERNET, you should look elsewhere, because you won't find any of that common sense here. When your game, through sheer always-online DRM ♥♥♥♥ery, makes it easier for pirates to play the game than PAYING ♥♥♥♥ING CUSTOMERS WHO DOLED OUT THEIR HARD EARNED MONEY EXPECTING A PRODUCT THAT JUST ♥♥♥♥ING WORKS THE WAY IT SHOULD IN RETURN, you have FAILED. Failed MISERABLY, in fact. And that save file ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to GFWL's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. It isn't just Rockstar games, either. Any game that uses GFWL is full of issues that are usually directly caused by it. A good general rule of thumb is to just avoid any game that has, or has ever had, GFWL integrated into it. You'll be setting yourself up for failure and disappointment, not necessarily in that order.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty CityPositives:+ WOW, this game has a huge amount of content for an expansion, so refreshing. Around 40 hours gameplay which is about the same as the original main game! Totally worth it for that reason alone. Lots of little side missions to complete.+ Graphics are good.+ Two different story arcs, one following the Lost Motorcycle Club and the other focused on Gay Tony, a nightclub owner. Both of these stories are interesting, the characters stand out and it's extremely fun.+ Nice shooting and combat as usual!+ Some real blockbuster moments towards the end, which is great.Negatives:I can't really see anything bad about this expansion. Tonnes of gameplay time, engaging and enjoyable, price comes down on sale regularly.Overall Score: 8.5/10To be honest, these two expansions alone could be more intriguing than the entire main game mode. At least, it's on par. Very good expansion that is worth purchasing when cheap. Look for it during the upcoming 2014 Christmas Sale, or for that matter, any major event in the future.

												Not super long (19 hours or so for both stories for me, and I like to mess around in the sandbox), but both The Lost and The Damned and The Ballad of Gay Tony capture the interest and humour that were so lacking in the main story. I would go so far as to recommend playing these episodes far more than playing Niko's story, which can be very slow at times. Surprisingly well optimised for a Rockstar game too.

content:
Posted: April 5
												9/10 - Grand Theft Auto: Episodes in Liberty City fixies so much about the previous game (Grand Theft Auto IV) as it manages to incorperate a serious story with fun gameplay as many aspects are added in/ added back in to the game, like parachutes, nightclubs. It is the nightclubs that really breath some life in to the Grand Theft Auto IV Trilogy as it offers fun gameplay with a number of funny situations and outcomes. GTA:EFLC even manages to improve other aspects of the game like the physics, which are considerably improved in this entry, I can't tell what they did to improve this but it just feels alot better and nature in this entry (TBoGt specifically). These added aspects do of course have their disadvantages, for one they easily expose the fact that the game map itself is quite small in comparison to other open worlds, this is evident by the use of multiple flying and parachuting sequences in game. If you like story based games as well as games with fun gameplay I don't see why you wouldn't like it, it's a win win situation

content:
Posted: April 8
												Ran fine in Windows 10 on a GTX 970 with the 11/29/2016 patch, maybe two crashes total.  You run this separate game to play either Lost and the Damned or the Ballad of Gay Tony.  Both are definitely optimized/tweaked/balanced more than the original GTA 4 (nice touches like mid-mission continues).  It's the same city but starts fully unlocked for both.  There are new characters and new interiors.  Neither require that you have beaten GTA4 first, but I highly recommend you do because there are crossovers.  See my review on GTA4 to get the basic idea... but if you like that and wnat more this is worth it.Lost and the Damned is all about a biker gang.  You don't have to use a bike in every mission, but in the few that require it I really hated having to cruise over slowly (since taxis are not an option).  Be ready for chase sequences where you have to aim, follow, and kill other drivers.  The story is depressing without anything terribly interesting about it.  Definitely the weaker of the two DLC and I would say it is missable entirely.Play the BoGT last!! It's a celebration of the game... not taking itself too seriously and getting into the thrill seeking side of GTA.  There are some optional "club management" sequences that play like I imagine the Sims is, but there's also some BASE jumping style stuff that really is a blast.  The story is chaotic but still fun.Based on the BoGT alone I'd give this a value of $8, assuming you've already beaten the GTA4 main game proper.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												I seriously can't believe I'm doing this, I'm giving a bad rate to a Grand Theft Auto game... I love the serie, I really do, but this PC version is just terrible! The game is a masterpiece, I've played it a million times on my Xbox 360, but this PC version is a just one of the worst ports I ever seen...The issue with this game is basically just one: Performance.The performance of this game is atrocious, the optimization is really bad. I have a medium-end PC that, according with the system requirements, would run it almost on the maximum performance. Guess what? I had to put the lowest game options on everything, no shadows, no anti-aliasing, minimum distance-view, no V-sync, and still only achieved 10 fps, lot of crashes, etc...Basically, this game is only playable in highest end PCs, and even on those the performance isn't really good.Until this game is properly optimized (which is never), I can't recomend this to anyone. Its really a shame, it's an imensely good game, but unplayble... Consider buying the consoles version.

content:
Posted: September 28, 2015
												This game consists of two components: The Ballad of Gay Tony and the Lost & Damned. For the Ballad of Gay Tony: This game was poorly constructed to misrepresent the context of the LGBT community and exagerates the steryotypes most heard of in the United States, consequently leading to the inevitable stockpile of cliches featured in the game. As for the Lost & Damned, it was a disappointment following the excellent storyline in GTA:IV. The level of engagement and realism is poor given the player will most likely not be able to relate to the player he is controlling. I personally did not enjoy this as much as GTA:IV or GTA:V.

												Easily these games are better then the normal GTA IV.While I love GTA IV a lot, I'll admit the story is meh, Niko isn't a very intresting charater and its kinda ironic that Roman often steals the spotlight in that game.However here you get two stories about two charaters, ones a biker and the other is a bouncer for a club, its very orignal and funny enough Rockstar made a fantastic Biker game that was orignal rather then Derp Sliver making a sh*tty one!I played over a 1000 hours of GTA IV back in 2008, I OWN IT ON DISC along with steam, however during the time of this review I haven't instailed it on steam so I can review it. I got it in a bundle with GTA IV for £6!More weapons then the orignal GTA IV, more cars and stuff and you get two stories for a cheaper price.Worth the price, get it.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												[**Contains pr*fanity, if you are sensitive to words and can see through asterisks, this review may not be for you**]I'm sure the game is great (I liked GTA IV a lot on 360 but never got around to playing the expansions).That being said, f*ck Games for WIndows Live. First, I can't run the game without crashing, then I finally get GFWL working (the step I missed when giving up on Dark Souls months ago (which I still haven't played) was apparently restarting my computer after installing the correct version of GFWL which had to be obtained manually online (why microsoft made an operating system that doesn't work properly out of the box with the stupid stupid GFWL thing that they created (and should be ashamed of) is beyond me).So, some number of days ago I got the stupid GFWL thing working so that I could play the game, what's this I see immediately? 'Sign in to some special "Rockstar social club" thing to play online'... um... ok... sure, I mean I didn't have to do any of this stupid pointless stuff when I played on console... but sure...So I make the account and think, well at least it's not like that stupid thing in Dark Souls (which I ran once to see if it worked) where I had to create a windows live profile to even save the game (foreshadowing... creepy).So I start up the expansion and, about 10 seconds in, realize that the keyboard controls are unplayable, at least from what I'm used to, I honestly don't know how anyone could play this with a keyboard, but whatever, I've needed a better controller for a while now so I ordered a 360 knockoff from ebay and forgot about GTA for a while.So the controller comes in and I get around to playing GTA, first, somewhat of an aside, I go to the graphics section and see a benchmark. Oh neat! I think to myself, I can run a benchmark and see if I want to try and push any of the recomended settings a bit higher, good deal. The benchmark runs to completion and then...PC : EFLC.exe has stopped working. Me: Oh well, it was a nice thought while it lasted.Anyway, I forget the benchmark and start the game, seems pretty good so far, kind of a long winded intro and they introduce a follow the leader mechanic which looks like it's going to be kind of annoying, oh look a safehouse... that's cool, look at all of the things I can do, I'll have to check that out...Game: Autosave feature has failed, you need to sign in to a LIVE-enabled account to saveMe: Of course, I knew expecting there to only be one account that I need to play this game was too much to ask for... nevermind the fact that I never needed to sign in to live when playing on the console, and nevermind that I'm just trying to SAVE MY GAME IN A SINGLE PLAYER GAME MODE WITHOUT SIGNING INTO AN ONLINE SERVICE. Whatever, you win this round M$.Naturally I can't be bothered to remember what e-mails I've used for various Live accounts in the past (i've had several) so I decide to make a new one from scratch.Wait, let me back up. You see, before I can get a Live account, I first need a Microsoft account for it to make the Live account from. OK, I'll bite:Name: 	First: F*kYouAsswh*lesIJustWantToF*kingPlayGTA	Last: ThisIsSoF*kingStupidF*kEveryOneOfYou[Note: asterisks added for this public review, the misspellings are because, apparently, if you're name contains profanity it can't be used for a M$ account, even though it's a required field.]Username: f*ckGamesForWindowsLiveWith@BigRusty.Pole[again the asterisk is mine, the correct spelling of the word this time is also not a typo]Password: *****[I guess I'll keep this one to myself for posterity, but, fun fact, originally it contained the word f**k, which was also set as the first name at the time (my form went through many revisions), the first error on trying to submit a form I saw was 'password cannot contain your name... hmm... TIL]Country: USZip: 55555Bday: 1/1/1905Gender: femalePhone: 5555555555Now, believe it or not, the form above worked properly (e-mail address and all) and I was taken to a one-click page to create my live account, how convenient!MS Site:"Uh oh... that shouldn't have happened.It appears you've found a glitch in the system.date:	6/20/2014 5:49:28 AMcode:	151E6149FFD7D49s:	q7KeB4D+ajX3cUOHdznk/A==id:	62a70191-7a10-40c4-8eea-61644ac6d1c7req:	4c6e9268-5bd8-422c-a026-7b510f36ecf9"Me: Woohoo! I win!! I broke your system, I broke your system *does a dance*Anyway, yes, I had p*ssed [Edit: really guys? ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ is a bad word?] them off, I'm not entirely sure how or what they were going to use for my username, but I ended up with the account ID/name: TendedFever6 which I guess is cute, but I digress.So I go back to GTA, and I enter in the oh-so-wonderful e-mail address and type in my password and enter in the key that Steam gave me (that it finally decided to ask for) and blah blah blah and what's this, did it work? am I done?Live: LIVE needs an update!Me: God, of course, whatever, just shut up and do it, I don't care, just have your way with me if you must, just please, don't hurt me again.Live: Live is updating, this may require restarting your computer.Me: You better not restart my f*cking computer you piece of sh*tLive: Do do do, I am updating, do do doMe: I swear to god, if you restart my f*cking computer...Live: Guess what! you need to restart this game for the update thingy to work, so do that because we hate you.Me: You realize I haven't saved? The game took me like 15 min in until it showed the first safehouse before prompting the autosave (or showing a bed) and I can't save now because you won't let me until I sign in, and immediately after you let me sign in you told me that there was an update that I needed or I would be signed out, and then I said OK update and so you updated and need to close my game, which I haven't saved.So I resign myself to go back to the game, turn off the autosave feature because I'm soft-locked with it enabled, make one last attempt to find some way to manually save even though I know it's futile, and then I close the game.Then Microsoft does it's stupid update on it's stupid ♥♥♥♥♥♥ piece of software that's just as ♥♥♥♥♥♥ after the update as it was beforehand.And then I launch the game. And then I sign into my profile, and then I'm logged in and it seems to work. I start up the expansion, it starts to load... and then I press Alt+F4 because I'm not in the mood to replay the 10-15 minutes that I lost, because I'm not in the mood to look at a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ GFWL game right now, and I feel dirty after what I've just had to do to be able to save a single player campaign.GTA is a great franchise, GFWL is a piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ Unfortunately they used that piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥to port this game, so ♥♥♥♥ it and ♥♥♥♥ Microsoft for making it the most appealing option.If you run Windows 8 (I'm not proud, the PC came with it, but that's another rant) be ready for a potential headache if you haven't already figured out the whole 'getting games like Dark Souls and GTA IV to run because GFWL likes to error and fail by default'. Also, if you're like me and don't want to create yet another mostly-legitimate account for something you don't have any plan to use for much anything else at any time in the near future (but who doesn't have an XBox, right? maybe people who had the system die on them and didn't bother to get a replacement because there's other consoles out there that don't have a stupid high RROD fail rate? nah, that's crazy talk).Again, I hear the expansions are great, but get 'em on PS3 or something, this is the type of thing that should just not be encouraged.Anyway, I had a fun waste of an evening and decided to waste even more time making this wonderful rant of a post. To anyone who made it this far, congrats and have a nice day.Edit: Formatting.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												It's fun to see the stories from GTA 4 and Episodes crossing like this. Up till now I've finished Ballad of Gay Tony and one thing I have to say is that it fixes some issues I had with the base GTA 4 - namely, when restarting the missions, they start from the point in time when the mission really begins, leaving out driving to the place, etc. Also, there are checkpoints in longer missions. Because of that I didn't notice what seemed like a bug in the main game - that even though the mission is restarted, you don't get back ammo and armour. It's shorter, of course, and funny, which is also a nice change after the main story.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2012
												Grand Theft Auto IV: Episodes from Liberty City. Это пак из 2 дополнений для Grand Theft Auto IV не требующие оригинала, то есть - это отдельные игры от оригинала дополнения у наследовали, название и геймплей, движок и плохую оптимизацию при порте на PC платформу. Сюжет рассказывает о: байкере Джонни Клейбеце и о телохранителе Энтони "Голубого Тони" Принца которого зовут Луиз Лопез,он работает на бизнесмэна работающего в сфере развлечений. За Джонни нам предлогают сыграть 25 миссий, плюс дофига побочных заданий таких, как "Войны группировок, угон машин" и так далее. За Луиза 28 миссий, плюс дофига побочных заданий таких, как "бейзджампинг, управлениями в ночное время клубами" и можно тусить в клубах и при удачном с течении обстоятельств. Луизу может чего-нибудь перепадет именно в "этом" смысле. Игра хорошая, моя оценка 92/100.

content:
Posted: April 9, 2015
												TL:DR -> see last lineFor all the people that think GFWL has to do with saves: it doesn't. Those people have just no idea. GFWL was NEVER a cloud saving system, that means that it DID NOT delete your saves, NOR it makes you unable to save at the moment. The game is totally fine in single player, in fact I booted up just this week to have some car fun. And guess what, I downloaded it from the steam library, launched, quit, imported my old save files (from 2010) I had on the HDD and put it in the right folder, launched the game again, and took from exactly where I left my character in 2010. GFWL *is not* connected to the savefiles, they are on the HDD. If you are not clever enough to understand that you should have backed up the savegame files before uninstalling the game last time, DON'T write reviews which are not helpful for the other users.I am speaking about single player. So: SINGLE PLAYER is totally fine and save system is fine too. I am not sure about multiplayer, but yes, it would be understandable that the online portion is totally failing at the moment. ***But single player is 100% the way it was before.***

												Requires xBox or Social Club account and constant internet connection.  Have both xBox live and Rockstar accounts - none of them worked with Liberty City but worked with other games.  Created another xBox live account to play.I am fed up with this required internet connectivity and DRM's.As for the game - if your bike is ruined during combat - loose mission.If your homy's bike is ruined during combat - loose mission.I found it somewhat unorthodox to arrive at the mission point, and then spend time to repark my stupid homies' bikes, while running in line of fire, trying not to die.Very finese piece this one is.FAIL.

												"This port seems to be a higgldy piggldy mess of cobbled together trash i'm afraid."Before i attempted to sink my teeth into this game,  was bludgeoned with several issues to get the game started.That is: Before you play this game, you must have a GAMES FOR WINDOWS LIVE account to actually start it, inwhich that is already crap, but if you want further♥♥♥♥♥♥in the bowl, then a fresh serving of a old version with thegame that autoinstalls, so you have to clean up the old "GFWL" and install the new one off the website. Andalso have to have a rockstar social club to shut it up after, like a arrogant toddler who didn't get his icecream.Then i managed to start the game and i was lifted up int- What the ♥♥♥♥ is this?... Seriously... What the ♥♥♥♥ is this?Did i just go back in time to where pc games were a further joke? I think i did. A MASSIVE. CONSISTENT...15... framesper second with shadows and reflections on... Bloody hell rockstar, look if you're going to do a port. Make it a goodone don't just slapdash it together with the drunkest of your employees and have the high as hell PR department say"GERD JERB"... Overall. It's an embarrasing port, thats a blemish of a actually fun collection of the two gta 4 dlc's.But drop the idea of playing it on PC. As a I7, with 8gb of ram and a 2gig card you'll still be lucky to play it all on highsettings.Basically: You dun ♥♥♥♥d up pc ports. Waiting to get GTA 5. 												"This port seems to be a higgldy piggldy mess of cobbled together trash i'm afraid."Before i attempted to sink my teeth into this game,  was bludgeoned with several issues to get the game started.That is: Before you play this game, you must have a GAMES FOR WINDOWS LIVE account to actually start it, inwhich that is already crap, but if you want further♥♥♥♥♥♥in the bowl, then a fresh serving of a old version with thegame that autoinstalls, so you have to clean up the old "GFWL" and install the new one off the website. Andalso have to have a rockstar social club to shut it up after, like a arrogant toddler who didn't get his icecream.Then i managed to start the game and i was lifted up int- What the ♥♥♥♥ is this?... Seriously... What the ♥♥♥♥ is this?Did i just go back in time to where pc games were a further joke? I think i did. A MASSIVE. CONSISTENT...15... framesper second with shadows and reflections on... Bloody hell rockstar, look if you're going to do a port. Make it a goodone don't just slapdash it together with the drunkest of your employees and have the high as hell PR department say"GERD JERB"... Overall. It's an embarrasing port, thats a blemish of a actually fun collection of the two gta 4 dlc's.But drop the idea of playing it on PC. As a I7, with 8gb of ram and a 2gig card you'll still be lucky to play it all on highsettings.Basically: You dun ♥♥♥♥d up pc ports. Waiting to get GTA 5. Then i'll see if they have redeemed themselves...

content:
Posted: May 17, 2015
												Lots of initial problems. Bundled with crappy rockstar software that does not work from the get go. Problem:When I turn on the game through Steam shows up: Log in Social Club When I click play, nothing happens. Solution:"Download and install the latest version of Games for Windows - LIVE (" GFWL ") PC Client. The version installed with this older game is no longer compatible with modern operating systems.You can get this from the microsoft (xbox) website. Downloading it from there is the only thing that works.EDIT: STILL not working.  Now i am getting: failed to start application [2000] -> 0x000002E4EDIT 2:Set all the exe files in the install directory to compatability with windows xp. Installed update to windows live gaming.I finally got it working. Game is fun for short periods of time. It does not hold my attention like some other games do. Negatively ranked due to all the initial problems and stress and having to install extra programs just to get the game working. I would only recommend this on consoles.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2015
												Great game compared to what people say. Even though it was a step back from GTA San Andreas on some points, like the removal of planes, it took GTA to the next era by adding Online modes like freemode (Which was a lot of fun back in the day) and improving the graphics. It improved on GTA IV by adding 2 new characters with their only seperate and unique stories and added new features like parachutes (Which for whatever reason are only in The Ballad of Gay Tony and not in The Lost and Damned which is a bit strange) and new vechicles and strangely enough the vechicles that appear in each story, don't appear in the other one which doesn't really make sense. Both stories and characters are unique and completely different from eachother.  Would recommend for fans of GTA. It is a game worth getting.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
												I actually played this game on Windows 7 and it was a very fun experience (especially the "The Ballad of Gay Tony" episode). However, after updating to Windows 10 I stopped being able to play it. Nevermind the online guides asking you to uninstall and reinstall this or that Games for Windows Live version, Visual C++ 2005 or .Net 3.5 (I tried them all) - it doesn't work on Windows 10. Forget about it. Save your money or buy something else on Steam. Fortunately Microsoft will make Windows 10 backward compatible with whatever piece of legacy software that is conflicting with the game laucher, or Rockstar will release a patch that will make the game work. Until then, spend your money on other game.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
												A great add on to GTA IV. This is how DLC should be done (even though it is technically not dlc since you don't need the base game to play it). It's like a brand new game. A ♥♥♥♥ton of more wepons and addons that GTA IV should of came with. Parachutes, AA12's (with explosive ammo), gernade launcher, sticky bombs, new cars and so much more. The story of both TLAD and TBOGT are both good and actually have effort put into them. Personally, I think TBOGT has a better and more intresting storyline but they're both great. This would be the ultimate bargain if Rockstar would of not of ditched GTA IV and EFLC once GTA V came out since this game(s) still have the cancerous tumor which is GFWL attached on it like a blood sucking leech. Also, the multiplayer is a lost cause at this point. Since Rockstar completely abandoned GTA IV multiplayer, it is a broken mess and if you do get it working after configuring the game's files, close to nobody is even on multiplayer. (atleast in my experience)Overall, I would recommend EFLC in a heart beat.♥♥♥♥♥♥ If this game was price at $60 i'd still buy it just for BOGT since it's such an amazing improvement over GTA IV. Totally Reccomend.

												Despiste being one of the best Open World games, GTA IV / EFLC has also one of the WORST ports ever on PC.(use these commands to make the game run/load properly: -availablevidmem 60 -norestrictions -nomemrestrict)Introducing the main problems that you will face:1 - Games for Windows LIVE. You know? That s***ty Microsoft thing? Its in this game.2 - Social Club. Because reasons. If you have to create a LIVE account, why not making a Social Club account too?3 - Even if you have the best hardware for Gaming, you will find the most s***ty feature ever implemented in a game, and it works awfully bad. Presenting the "not enough memory available" crap, AKA "screw this im unnistalling this game, Ive searched the internet for 3 hours trying to fix this crap". Even if you have some of the best PC hardware, youre not safe from this, and GTA IV / EFLC will inform you most of the times that your hardware is weak and it only has 55MB of VRAM available (even if you have 4GB of VRAM) (you can also try to remove the restrictions but the game wont load most of the times, it will only work if you successfully make the game acknowledge that you have *insert your VRAM here*)

number of helpful: 1 of 7 people (14%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
												(Mostly pasted from my GTA IV review but slightly edited)Worth it for multiplayer and at 5 or so bucks but that's about it. I used to love this and the original game (Come on GTA V, it's not too late for single-player expansion packs...) but it has aged surprisingly horribly.Pros:+Euphoria physics are beyond awesome and ragdoll is the best in any game ever (apart from RDR and Max Payne 3 of course. Thank gosh for a mod that brings it back in GTA V)+Though controversial, I personally love the vehicle physics. Sets it apart from the other GTA's. Glad it went back to more arcadey with GTA V though+Characters are mostly likeable+Voice-acting is superb like usual from Rockstar+Melee system is fun+Great American satire+Often humourous (it's GTA...)+Story isn't as serious as GTA IV, more GTA style+Addition of checkpoints in missions unlike GTA IV+Good length for both expansion packsCons:-Graphics aged horribly due to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ art-style, lack of colours etc. (it's not even that old...)-Barely a problem at all, you get used to it real quick but the vehicle camera angle is kinda whack-GFWL is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ Not so bad though, just say offline which people seem dumb enough to not figure out-Not much to do in the world-Shooting is sorta ♥♥♥♥♥♥ feeling-Sound is forgettable, lackluster gun sounds etc.-Far less content than San Andreas and Vice City-Music is dogshit-Horrible optimizationSound: 5/10Graphics: 2/10Gameplay: 6/10Content/Replayability: 4/10Overall: 7/10The expansion packs are slightly better than GTA IV original, but honestly this game has aged horribly and yet it's only 9 years old. Not worth it at full price. Get it on sale.

Posted: December 27, 2010
												Bought this on sale for around £6 if memory serves. Just about the best value you could hope for. Two full length games in one. And GTA4 games at that.Runs slightly better on my system than GTA4 too, which is a bonus. New radio stations are nice, new vehicles and weapons are excellent, and the new stories are very well written, acted and told.As per usual you find it impossible to feel anything for the character you play, as they are both just scuzzy criminals with no morals and would kill their best friends for money, even though they keep going on about how important friends are.Gay Tony is by far the best of the two, with an awesome new helicopter gunship, and a fantastic auto-shotgun with explosive ammo that smashes vehicles to peices with each shot. Hilarity obviously ensues when you do this to a police car.I havent played MP yet, but it seems to be just the same thing as in GTA4, so if you liked that you will like this.All in all a great game.

												My clean up of GFWL games continues so I never have to see that piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥again. This one follows what's become the typical GTA hierarchy; the music is the best part, followed by the story, then the driving, then the combat. Unfortunately, the story wasn't that great in this one. It started out pretty good but really unraveled at the end, seemingly just to rush the story to a conclusion. I enjoyed being on a chopper basically the entire time, and Liberty Rock Radio was damn good as expected, but other sandbox series have really left the gameplay of GTA in the dust. Hopefully Rockstar North realizes that and really tightens it up for V.

Posted: May 16, 2013
												When playing GTA4 one should not avoid GTA: Episodes From Liberty City. We are back in Liberty City, but not as Nico. Instead we jump into the shoes of Johny Klebitz, a Vice President of the biker gang "The Lost", and into the shoes of Luis Fernando Lopez, a close friend of "Gay" Tony, who is one of the major players in town, who owns several night clubs. Both stories tells a story set in Liberty City from a different perspective. When put together with Nico's story, GTA4 finally comes to it's conclusion. Johny, Luis and Nico are three great characters in GTA4, and it is entertaining to experience all their stories and the outcomes of those stories.Gameplay is pretty much the same as with normal GTA4, so if you had problems with helicopters... then really don't expect a difference...In the end though GTA4 is amazing and that feeling is only boosted with Episodes From Liberty City

Posted: July 10, 2014
												Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City delivers two games based on the world of Liberty City. Both games -- The LOST & Damned and The Ballad of Gay Tony -- offer expansive, story-based experiences inside this wild and dangerous city. The package does not require a copy of the original Grand Theft Auto IV to play.THE LOST AND DAMNED -- Johnny is a veteran member of The Lost, a notorious biker gang. Johnny has been creating BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES for The Lost in Liberty City, but his first loyalty must be to the patch he wears on his back and to Billy Grey, the club's President. However, when Billy returns from rehab hell-bent on bloodshed and debauchery, Johnny finds himself in the middle of a vicious turf war with rival gangs for control of a city torn apart by violence and corruption. Can the brotherhood survive?THE BALLAD OF GAY TONY -- Grand Theft Auto IV's second downloadable episode injects Liberty City with an overdose of guns, glitz, and grime. As Luis Lopez, PART-TIME hoodlum and full-time assistant to legendary nightclub impresario Tony Prince (aka "Gay Tony"), players will struggle with the competing loyalties of family and friends, and with the uncertainty about who is real and who is fake in a world in which everyone has a price.

												A weird occasion, but it is that case when DLC is actually better than the main game. tBoGT goes from strict realism to crazy fun with stealing train cars, racing with nitro and jumping to a taking off plane from a motorbike. This one somewhy reminded me of Vice City, with it's gloss, sunshine and one particularly eccentric person. Yusuf Amir, son of a wealthy Arab businessman, very much reminded me of Diaz. The plot is great and fun, with lots of new interesting characters, as well as cameos from the original game. The relations between Lois (the main character) and Gay Tony (his boss) are a very well-presented story of a friendship. If you own a GTA IV, or you just consider yourself a GTA fan, this one is a must-buy.

Posted: April 25, 2011
												I am fiscally minded with video game purchases, so naturally I found the complete GTA IV trilogy on sale and bought it knowing what I was getting.  IV was great, but the feeling of restriction at the start bugged me, so when fired up this game I feared such pains again.  Not so, as I learned.  You get two storylines, both having the things that made GTA IV fun, and new stuff as well.  But what really got me was the fact that the world was wide open from the start, no strings attached!  Although missions like to congregate in certain places at certain points, the feeling of freedom is a welcome feeling to me.  If you want Liberty City at it's best, get this game, it's a great addition to the GTA series.     It should also be worth mentioning that most (if not all) GTA IV mods will work with these games, so if you want to cause even more chaos you shouldn't have trouble making that happen.

Posted: November 25, 2013
												DLC well-aligned with GTA spirit.Episodes from Liberty city is something we were all expecting when we finished GTA IV. We were left with that feeling of something missing, gnawing at us, not knowing exactly what we wanted: this was it.  Those of us who have played the series from the beginning know that it carries a somewhat serious story that is permeated with a silly, fun, and exciting sense of humor under the surface. What was lacking from the base game was restored with this excellent DLC.The first episode consists of The Ballad of Gay Tony, which takes place in the same Liberty City as the base game. The main protagonist is Luis Lopez, a Dominican-American who is the co-owner of a club with partner Gay Tony.  The episode is much faster-paced than the base game, which is understandable, as the episode only lasts around 15 hours if you do a lot of the side missions and mess around like I did.  This means that missions progress the story rapidly, with large, life-changing events taking place in a short period of time.  I found this extremely enjoyable, as many of the missions are borderline plausible, over-the-top, ridiculous fun.  The voice acting is commendable, and every character is realized in a totally believable way. Luis deals with problems at home, past relationships, and his volatile partner consistently throughout the game. You get to fly new vehicles which allow for a large degree of destruction.  New and exotic weapons are unlocked periodically, and they also help spice up the gameplay.  This was a great addition, since being stuck with the same guns as the forty hour base game would probably have made the gunplay stale. The shooting and cover mechanics carry over from the base game, and they are still .  I still think the shooting mechanics could have been polished up a bit from the original. The story is evenly paced and has only a few irritating missions, and difficulty spikes are kept to a minimum. I can comfortably say that The Ballad of Gay Tony is a worthwhile addition to the GTA IV expirience.Now, the second episode, called The Lost and Damned, delivers a similar expirience with a few drawbacks pertaining mostly to the story.  I played the Gay Tony episode first, and I was left with a great sense of satisfaction after the conclusion. Playing this after also left me with a sense of satisfaction, but to a lesser degree.  I liked the story almost all the way through, and then it wound down extremely fast near the end, leaving me wanting more.  The game really should have included more missions exploring the background of the gang, and also more commentary related to the gang's past.  I felt that a lot of the dialogue included mentions of past events that were not developed in any way. Some of the characters were also unlikeable, including the protagonist, who can seem bland at times compared to Luis Lopez. Another thing that bothers me throughout the entire game is the muted, dark color palette and grainy film effect that is present in the entire game. I can understand that the developers were shooting for a sixties biker theme, but the effect can get annoying after a few hours. Negatives aside, the game carries over a lot of the good things from Gay Tony, including the fast-paced weapon progressions, over-the-top missions (less so compared to BOGT), and excellent voice acting. This is still a solid addition to the base game, and features memorable characters and missions, although muted in full-blown silliness and adrenaline compared to TBOGT. This DLC pack was something that I did not expect when GTA IV was out.  The pratice of selling DLC was becoming common practice around release date, but Rockstar has never made smaller, riskier pieces of extra content on their games before.  For a first try, they really got a lot of things right, and overall, this DLC package is a must play if you are a fan of the series.  Especially at the current price, you cannot miss the memorable expiriences in both episodes. I suggest you play The Lost and Damned first, and save the best for last.

Posted: March 1, 2016
												“Man was born for society. However little He may be attached to the World, He never can wholly forget it, or bear to be wholly forgotten by it. Disgusted at the guilt or absurdity of Mankind, the Misanthrope flies from it: He resolves to become an Hermit, and buries himself in the Cavern of some gloomy Rock. While Hate inflames his bosom, possibly He may feel contented with his situation: But when his passions begin to cool; when Time has mellowed his sorrows, and healed those wounds which He bore with him to his solitude, think you that Content becomes his Companion? Ah! no, Rosario. No longer sustained by the violence of his passions, He feels all the monotony of his way of living, and his heart becomes the prey of Ennui and weariness. He looks round, and finds himself alone in the Universe: The love of society revives in his bosom, and He pants to return to that world which He has abandoned. Nature loses all her charms in his eyes: No one is near him to point out her beauties, or share in his admiration of her excellence and variety. Propped upon the fragment of some Rock, He gazes upon the tumbling waterfall with a vacant eye, He views without emotion the glory of the setting Sun. Slowly He returns to his Cell at Evening, for no one there is anxious for his arrival; He has no comfort in his solitary unsavoury meal: He throws himself upon his couch of Moss despondent and dissatisfied, and wakes only to pass a day as joyless, as monotonous as the former.” ― Matthew Gregory Lewis, The Monk

												GTA IV Marked the beginning, and Episodes From Liberty City Opens the Next Two Chapters of this new Era of GTA.The Lost and The Dammned brings us into the shoes of Patriotic Young Middle Age Biker Johnny Klebitz, from the start you feel like part of the gang, you ride your Metallic Stallion down the highway with your brothers in tow, banter and insults fly as you cruise around the city, you couldn't feel more at home behind the handbars until now.The Ballad of Gay Tony shows us the highlife of Liberty Cities Posh,  Rich and the Stupid, as we roll into the sneakers of Luis Lopez, and we see the return of more of the sillyness GTA IV denied us in IV, Solid Gold Helicopters you say? SWAT Tanks? they're all here, along with the Fast Cars, Fast Women, and Good Guns.Episodes from Liberty City fits snuggly into the already established Story of IV involving Coccaine Diamonds and Rivalry, you haven't had the full experiance till you've played these GemsEpisodes of Liberty City gets 8/10

Posted: December 27, 2015
												Having beaten GTA4 I can assume this one kicks♥♥♥♥♥ as well.I toyed with it a bit to make sure it worked and I'll write more on the actual game once I've had a chance to play it. But I'm writing this to offer a bit of help with anyone having trouble with the graphics memory setting being maxed out despite actually having enough RAM to run the game.This is what worked for me:IN your computer's program files folders, go to  \Steam\steamapps\common\Grand Theft Auto IV Episodes from Liberty City\EFLC Make a  text file  using Windows Notepad and write  -availablevidmem 14.0  in it, nothing else, and save it to that folder (I don't know why 14.0 works for me, but it does, fiddle with it if it's too much or too little)Then, right-click the  LaunchEFLC  and click  Send to > Desktop (create shortcut)  Now, on the Desktop shortcut, right-click and go to  Properties In the  Target:  after the  "... Liberty City\EFLC\LaunchEFLC.exe"  type in  -availablevidmem 14.0  hit  Apply  and close it out. Now, from the desktop shortcut, right-click and  Run as Administrator  and hopefully you should be able to adjust the Graphics Memory in the game options and play the game.(Edit Note: Once you've established that the game works, it can be launched from Steam. Also, this game kicks so much ♥♥♥♥ing♥♥♥♥♥it's ridiculous.)I hope this helps. If not, there's a billion work-arounds out there and I had to figure this out by trying all of them and using the one that worked for me. Good luck.

Posted: January 5, 2016
												The episodes from Liberty City are alot like the expansions to the original Half Life game, both add a lot to the story of the original game, and add a good deal of new content as well.The Lost MC Campaign: This story follows the Lost MC biker gang as their second in command (the player) is trying to keep the gang alive and prospering while the current leader is using the members for his own purposes. The levels throughout this offer alot of action and an interesting mechanic of staying in formation with your other bikers when riding. It reveals other perspectives to the main story of GTA 4 and gives plenty of backstory on characters that were not touched to much before. There are also a few new weapons in this and some fun motorcycles to ride, which oddly enough were easier to control than in GTA 4.The Ballad of Gay Tony: This campaign shows you the life and empire of the club owner Gay Tony and his right hand man Luis (the plater). Everything from this type of campaign is present from drugs, to shootouts, and club adventures. This campaign does a decent job of exploring a few select characters backgrounds and offers tons of new weapons to try out throughout the game. The missions in this campaign are a lot more fun as the introduction of the parachute is present allowing you to jump out of helicopters and high rise buildings to escape danger. I would consider this campaign to be alot more fun gameplay wise than The Lost MC, while The Lost MC offers more story wise.Both campaigns are phenominal, and short enough to keep you entertained while playing and long enough to enjoy them all the way though.

Posted: January 8, 2015
												The Ballad Of Gay Tony Review:GTA Liberty City Episodes TBOGT was a Fabulous DLC. It brought many new features into the already amazing GTA 4, new features consisting of New Radio Stations, New Weapons, Parachute, Vehicles, Night Clubs & Dancing etc... The storyline itself was excellent it tied in perfectly with the GTA 4 Setting and it was amazing seeing how they interconnected, the protagonist himself is quite awesome, he has a big heart and also gets his hands dirty if necessary, Tony's character is also great to watch because your basically his babysitter and best friend. All the characters you interact with are memorable especially the protagonist and Tony, the missions themself are fun & entertaining to play.Overall TBOGT improved upon the fabulous GTA 4 in every way. The Gameplay is fun and will bring many hours of entertainment, The Story is Beautiful and fun to play out. I enjoyed this game from start to finish, and the freeroam has been entertaining aswell.In the end, I would highly Reccommend GTA Liberty City Episodes, TBOGT Is a beautiful GTA 4 DLC that is a must have for any GTA Fan.

Posted: January 21, 2015
												After a fair bit of playing this game, I thought I'd write an honest review about it (almost unheard of with me).A lot of people are saying how GFWL has broken this game and how it is the main reason to not buy this game. Honestly, GFWL doesnt affect my gameplay nor should it affect yours. I have gotten GFWL to work from the first day, but I never use it because literally no one plays multiplayer on this game anymore. So, therefore, GFWL is not needed.Also, people are saying that the PC version of this is broken. No, its not. So far, I have seen no extra bugs from what the other platforms already have with the exception of two problems - the fact that if you have a graphics card with 2GB or more for video memory GTA IV is not going to pick it up, and that The Lost and Dammed lags extensively. For the garphics problem, all you have to do is create a 'commandline.txt' file in the game directory increasing the 'availablevidmem' size. A lot of people dont know this and therefore, label the game as "broken". My computer has a nVidia GeForce 830m with 2GB of graphics, and it runs like a dream on the highest settings. For the extensive lag in TLaD, its unplayable. Even with the graphics turned down to the lowest possible settings, it lags from anywhere between 5 and 12 frames (for me personally). Also, the reaction times are severly affected due to the fact that the game will delay the action you want it to for at least 3 seconds. For example, if you go to shoot someone, it will not register the mouse click until 2-3 seconds later. Same for the keyboard input and mouse movement.The number one reason I bought this game was to mod it with the LCPDFR mod. But since then, I have installed multiple mods and it makes the gameplay twice as fun as with no mods. I have also clocked The Ballad of Gay Tony two times as I really enjoy the storyline. For me personally, its a game that will never get old.The computer I have used to help with this review:HP Pavilion 15-P008TU laptopIntel Core i5 @ 2.6Ghz processornVidia GeForce 830m graphics card8GB DDR3 memoryWin8.1 64bitNot a lot is required to run this game, as I could run it on medium graphics on a machine that was three times as weaker as this one above, using Win7 64bit.I legitimetely think this is a great game and I would seriously recommend it to anyone who is looking for an awesome game with a great storyline and freeplay as well as good modding capabilty. Just use TLaD at your own risk.

Posted: February 18, 2015
												This is a great DLC for the already great GTA IV. You play as a night club co - owner caled Luis, who if you have played the main game or the first DLC, The Lost And Damned, you will have already seen before in cut scene situations. The gameplay is fluid, and exciting. This DLC adds a complete new story line under this new character, meaning a whole new barrel full of hilarious situations and side missions. There have been more activities added such as golf, and a whole host of night club based activities. Many new weapons are added, including remote detonated sticky bombs, which all help to make the game just as fun and destructive as a GTA game should be.Overall I think this DLC couldn't have been any better, and because of that I give it 10/10.

Posted: February 19, 2015
												First of all, don't listen to all the noobs who can't install Games For Windows Live and say it's broken and not working. It's false. GFWL installs with no problems whatsoever and you can login simply by registering on the games for windows website and installing the latest version of the software. Online also works, but very few players play this at the moment. Also, if for some reason you're not able to log in to the GFWL service you can still make an offline (LOCAL) profile and save your game, no problem at all. It's always been like that with GFWL, there was really no need to be online if you wanted to play single player. That being said, the game is just fine. I suppose people are just too dumb or spoiled so they trash this game because they don't know how to register on a site, update software or find the local profile option. I like GTA, although GTA IV and Episodes from Liberty City are my least favourite. I don't like the handling and the city feels kinda dead in comparisson to GTA San Andreas (which, speaking of, also is getting trashed by people for no reason at all. It did lose some songs, but that's about it. Been playing it for a long time since the update, no graphics glitches, no crashes, no anything.)I bought the game on sale and recommend for you to buy it too if you're a fan of sandbox games. Don't listen to the negative reviews regarding GFWL, it works just fine, you just have to use your brain a tiny little bit :)Buy GTA IVDownload the gameStart the gameRegister and login with Rockstar Social ClubRegister and login with Games For Windows LiveUpdate GFWL to the latest version from their website if neededPlay the game.orBuy GTA IVDownload the gameStart the gameRegister and login with Rockstar Social ClubStart a new local profile on Games for Windows LivePlay the game.Simple as that.

Posted: April 11, 2015
 Is it worth your money? ♥♥♥♥ Yeah! If you loved Gta IV than you'll love this even more! Im going to split this review into two sections one reviewing TLAD and TBOGT. Lost and the Damned Before I begin note that I played this first before I played TBOGT and my feeling for The lost and the Damned change once I played it but I'll try not to show any bias here. The story isnt as great as IV in TLAD so I wont really be mentioning it in the review. One big reason I love TLAD is because of how it brings you straight into the action unlike Gta IV which made me more hesitant towards marathoning this game through (the begining atleast). Another element of the game that made more happy to drive to the far away mission markers was that because I knew that I would be doing something badass in every mission like ambushing a convoy or stopping a prison bus the missions are really varied compared to Gta IV's drive here and kill this guy and that element is still here is just executed in a better manner. The new weapons are also a plus like the new Auto-Shotgun(auto shottie is bae) and automatic 9.mm which make firefights more intense. The Ballad of Gay Tony I went into TBOGT with me thinking that it would be like TLAD which is still good but the moment I realized that after 5 hours of starting the game I was  blowing up helicopters on top of the Empire State Building with an explosive shotgun and than I realized which game was superior. Not only that but the story isnt half bad because of all the crazy and hilarious characters you run across not to mention the even more crazier things they ask you to do. Their is a staggering amount of new stuff to do and use in the game participating in a triathilon,doing a drug deal with some friends or going on a civilian rampage with the games new tank (not really a tank) called the ACP. Score In the end I would reccomend this game to any gta fan or even any person who likes free roam games. The Lost and the Damned  8.4/10 The Ballad of Gay Tony  9.7/10

												As expansion packs go, this is easily amongst the best.Presenting GTA IV's Liberty City in two entirely different lights, these two games offer several hours each of extra missions and new characters, all set in the same world as the main game.The Lost and Damned follows a pack of bikers as they wage war on a rival gang, whilst struggling with their own internal politics.  The presentation of the world here is one far grittier even than Nico Belic's. The characters are well-realised throughout.  The focus on motorbikes (specifically choppers) is a nice move away from a focus on cars.The Ballad of Gay Tony demonstrates the lighter, brighter side of Liberty City, far more in line with Vice City's glitzy parody of Miami.If you are a fan of GTA IV (or indeed any other GTA game) you should really have played this already!

Posted: January 4, 2014
												Two fantastic additions to the Grand Theft Auto IV standalone, both The lost and damned and The ballad of gay tony are very enjoyable, much like all GTA games. 												在GTA5发售之际，通了TBOGT的主线剧情，总的来说没有TLAD和正传的剧情来得震撼人心，但是也足够合格了（我喜欢大团圆的结局）。剧情对于自由城上流社会生活做了非常丰富的描写，人物性格也非常鲜明，疯狂的中东地产大亨Yusuf让我想起了正传里的Bruce，不过他更加丧心病狂（Bruce反而在TBOGT里显得很规矩，大概是兄长Mori在的缘故），但是为人重情义，帮了主角Luis不少忙。本作的任务也堪称GTA4之最，游戏性几近GTASA（跳伞真的很好玩）。总而言之，该资料片对于GTA4原作是个非常好的补充。

Posted: February 19, 2015
												First of all, don't listen to all the noobs who can't install Games For Windows Live and say it's broken and not working. It's false. GFWL installs with no problems whatsoever and you can login simply by registering on the games for windows website and installing the latest version of the software. Online also works, but very few players play this at the moment. Also, if for some reason you're not able to log in to the GFWL service you can still make an offline (LOCAL) profile and save your game, no problem at all. It's always been like that with GFWL, there was really no need to be online if you wanted to play single player. That being said, the game is just fine. I suppose people are just too dumb or spoiled so they trash this game because they don't know how to register on a site, update software or find the local profile option. I like GTA, although GTA IV and Episodes from Liberty City are my least favourite. I don't like the handling and the city feels kinda dead in comparisson to GTA San Andreas (which, speaking of, also is getting trashed by people for no reason at all. It did lose some songs, but that's about it. Been playing it for a long time since the update, no graphics glitches, no crashes, no anything.)I bought the game on sale and recommend for you to buy it too if you're a fan of sandbox games. Don't listen to the negative reviews regarding GFWL, it works just fine, you just have to use your brain a tiny little bit :)Buy GTA IVDownload the gameStart the gameRegister and login with Rockstar Social ClubRegister and login with Games For Windows LiveUpdate GFWL to the latest version from their website if neededPlay the game.orBuy GTA IVDownload the gameStart the gameRegister and login with Rockstar Social ClubStart a new local profile on Games for Windows LivePlay the game.Simple as that.

Posted: February 18, 2015
												This is a great DLC for the already great GTA IV. You play as a night club co - owner caled Luis, who if you have played the main game or the first DLC, The Lost And Damned, you will have already seen before in cut scene situations. The gameplay is fluid, and exciting. This DLC adds a complete new story line under this new character, meaning a whole new barrel full of hilarious situations and side missions. There have been more activities added such as golf, and a whole host of night club based activities. Many new weapons are added, including remote detonated sticky bombs, which all help to make the game just as fun and destructive as a GTA game should be.Overall I think this DLC couldn't have been any better, and because of that I give it 10/10.

Posted: December 19, 2014
												These two fairly-short campaigns add back some of the more "video-gamey" elements that were missing in the main game.   And the friend system is much, much better. No more phone calls, dates with your friends are completely optional, and you still get the bonuses they provide (mobile gun shop, mission backup, free cars, etc.). Unfortunately you're married to your chopper in The Lost and the Damned, but The Ballad of Gay Tony is much more open-minded when it comes to what vehicle you choose to drive.Still has the same optimization issues as GTA IV, but still playable if you launch the game outside of Steam (directly from LaunchEFLC.exe).

Posted: November 25, 2016
												I have played and reviewed Grand Theft Auto IV and I can tell you EFLC runs slightly better. These two DLCs include everything from GTAIV and introduce several new weapons, vehicles, mechanics, etc...The Lost and Damned follows the story of Johnny Klebitz, who you may remember as he works with Niko in some missions, and the Lost MC. New weapons like the Sawed-Off Shotgun, Automatic 9mm, Pipe Bombs (and more) are fun to use, along with the unique cars/bikes which have been added.The Ballad of Gay Tony introduces a less miserable and depressing Liberty City and features weapons like the .44 Pistol, Automatic Shotgun, Advanced Sniper, Sticky Bombs (and more). You play as Luis Lopez, who was a hostage in the bank heist Niko and the McRearies pulled off. It has a very large variety of missions, too. It also features new cars, bikes, boats and helicopters (such as the popular 'Buzzard').In short, EFLC is a great addition to the franchise and is certainly worth playing if you enjoyed GTAIV.

content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
												As I mentioned in my review for the main game: This is an atrocious mess. Not just on Windows 10, either. This is designed to be a headache right out of the box on any version of Windows.I'll leave a brief summary of what I had to do to get this working: First off right-click the game title in the Steam library (not in Windoes Explorer like I initially did), click properties, and in 'launch options' put this line: -nomemrestrict -norestrictions ...that will make the game accept modern resolutions without crashing your computer. Then you'll want to take care of the GFWL crisis BEFORE YOU EVEN START THE GAME OTHERWISE YOU WON'T BE ABLE TO SAVE! (and they don't even warn you that you need to be logged into GFWL ahead of time, not even a whisper). Posted: June 2, 2011
												GTA IV Marked the beginning, and Episodes From Liberty City Opens the Next Two Chapters of this new Era of GTA.The Lost and The Dammned brings us into the shoes of Patriotic Young Middle Age Biker Johnny Klebitz, from the start you feel like part of the gang, you ride your Metallic Stallion down the highway with your brothers in tow, banter and insults fly as you cruise around the city, you couldn't feel more at home behind the handbars until now.The Ballad of Gay Tony shows us the highlife of Liberty Cities Posh,  Rich and the Stupid, as we roll into the sneakers of Luis Lopez, and we see the return of more of the sillyness GTA IV denied us in IV, Solid Gold Helicopters you say? SWAT Tanks? they're all here, along with the Fast Cars, Fast Women, and Good Guns.Episodes from Liberty City fits snuggly into the already established Story of IV involving Coccaine Diamonds and Rivalry, you haven't had the full experiance till you've played these GemsEpisodes of Liberty City gets 8/10

Posted: March 20, 2013
												GTA: Episodes from Liberty City is a nice DLC for GTA IV. This time you’re getting a chance to see the life of characters that crossed swords with Niko Bellic in GTA IV.You have Johnny who’s a veteran member of The Lost, a notorious biker gang. (The Lost and Damned).Then you have Luis Lopez a part-time hoodlum and full-time assistant to a nightclub owner Tony Prince also known as Gay Tony. (The Ballad of Gay Tony).Whether you play Johnny or Luis, you will still commit grand scale crimes in Liberty City and you’ll get to see how and why they crossed swords with Niko Bellic, so this DLC really gives a in depth view of the crime activities in Liberty City from all angles.I keep saying DLC, it’s not really. Because you don’t need to buy GTA IV in order to play this. It is in fact a standalone game. I recommend this game (and GTA IV, it's also a keeper!).Peace.
